If it is not yet tender enough, continue to cook it for another 30 minutes or until it is as tender as desired.

Toast the aromatics. Remove the small white pouch from the spice packet and momentarily set it aside. Pour the rest of the spices plus one additional cinnamon stick and 4 additional star anise into a dry pan ( no oil is needed). Toast on medium heat until fragrant. It should only take a a minute or two. Be careful not to burn the spices.
Pour the spices into the small white pouch and tie tightly to prevent any of the spices from escaping. Set it momentarily aside. Do not add it to the stock pot yet until the 2 hour mark!

Prep the garnish. Chop the green onions ( top green part only ), rough chop the cilantro and thinly slice the onion. Throw the bottom part of the green onions into the stock part or discard. Then place on a plate.
Wash and prep the herbs. Place the saw tooth coriander (optional) , thai basil, beansprouts, lemon wedges, and sliced jalapeno on a serving platter.
At the 2 hour mark, skim off the fat and any foam or scum from the top of the broth.
Remove the ginger, onions and daikons from the broth. Discard the vegetables.

Then add in the rock sugar, fish sauce and the small white pouch of spices. Now set a timer for 1 hour. Once the timer goes off, remove the small white pouch of spices from the broth and discard. You can leave the spices in broth up to 1 ½ hours.

Make the vinegared onions ( optional ). Thinly slice an onion. Squeeze an entire lemon over the sliced onions and mix. Add 1 tablespoon of sugar and mix. Add 1 tablespoon of sriacha hot sauce or adjust the amount of sriracha to your spice level and mix. Let stand for 30 to 45 minutes. The longer you let it stand, the softer the onions will become. I don't like them too soft, I prefer that they still have a bit of bite in them.

At the 3 hour mark, remove the small white pouch of spices and the bottom part of the green onions. Check on the tenderness of the oxtail. If it is not yet tender enough for you, then continue to cook oxtail until it is as tender as desired. At this point, if you wish you can remove the beef bones from the broth and discard. I like to leave the bones in the broth until the very end. Once the oxtail is tender, dump in the Vietnamese meatballs and bring the broth to a boil. The meatballs are pre-cooked so you only need to cook them in the broth for about 5 minutes or until they are heated through. Time to taste and adjust the broth! Add more fish sauce if necessary, one tablespoon at a time until it is as salty as desired. If you need it to be a bit sweeter, add another very small piece of rock sugar. Be careful to not add too much rock sugar as it may make the broth too sweet and pho should not be sweet.

Get ready to serve the pho ! Blanch the noodles. Fill a saucepan with water and bring it to a boil. Place some pho noodles in a strainer with a handle and then place the strainer into the boiling water. Blanch for 10 seconds and transfer the noodles to a bowl. Be careful not to overcook the noodles as they will become mushy.
Add the garnishes. Place some of the sliced onions, chopped green onions and chopped cilantro into the bowl.
Also add the oxtail and Vietnamese meatballs if you are using any.
Then ladle the boiling broth over the noodles and sprinkle on some black pepper.
Serve with a plate of herbs and vegetables. Place the thai basil, saw tooth coriander, beansprouts, sliced jalapenos and lime wedges onto a serving platter.
Serve with the vinegared onions as well ( optional ).

For the dipping sauce, squirt some sriracha and hoisin sauce into a small dipping bowl. If you like to add some spice to it then add some sate sauce and mix. You can also squirt some sriracha and hoisin sauce directly into your bowl of pho for additional flavor.
Next are some of the ingredients used in this recipe and a quick overview on the instructions:

Once you start cooking the broth and it has come to the first boil, reduce the heat to medium-low and set your first timer for 2 hours. After the broth has been simmering for 2 hours remove the ginger, onions and daikon.
Then place the pouch of spices into the pot and then set your timer again but this time for 1 hour.  You can leave the pouch in the pot up to  1 and 1/2 hours.
Then remove the pouch from the pot and discard it when the time goes off.
At the first boil, also set the second timer for the 3 hours. Once the timer goes off, check on the tenderness of the oxtail.
The oxtail should only take about 3 1/2 to 4 hours to become tender.  If it is not yet tender enough for you then continue to cook it until it reaches the tenderness that you desire.
Once the oxtail is done cooking, you can either remove the beef bones from the pot to make it easier for you to ladle the soup into the bowls or you can leave them in there until the end.
Then discard the bones when done.

name: Vietnamese Oxtail Soup With Vegetables
summary: This Oxtail Soup is a hearty and flavorful dish made by simmering oxtail with ginger, onions, and garlic for over two hours to create a rich broth. Vegetables like carrots, potatoes, and cabbage are added toward the end for extra depth and texture. Finished with fresh herbs, crispy shallots, and a bold chili dipping sauce, this comforting soup is perfect for a cozy, satisfying meal.
ingredients: 2 Yellow Onions (Peeled and left whole – Cut an “X” at the bottom & top)
1 Knob of Ginger (2 inches long – Sliced ¼ inch thick)
4 Cloves of Garlic (Peeled and left whole)
22 Cups Distilled Water (Plus an additional 3 cups needed toward the end)
3 Tablespoons Totole Granulated Chicken Flavor Soup Base Mix
steps: Parboil the bones. Place the bones in a large pot and fill with tap water. Bring to a boil then reduce the heat to medium. Boil for 10 minutes.
Occasionally remove the impurities from the top of the water and discard.
Once the bones have been parboiled, drain and wash the oxtails. Be sure to wash them well. Then wash the pot clean. Set aside.
Peel the onions and cut an “X” on the top and bottom. Set aside.
Peel the ginger and slice it diagonally ¼” inch thick. Set aside.
Then peel the garlic and leave them whole. Set aside.
Return the oxtails to the pot along with the whole peeled onions, sliced ginger, and peeled garlic cloves.
Pour in 22 cups of distilled water.

Add in 1 ½ tablespoons of salt, 3 tablespoons of Totole Granulated Chicken Flavor Soup Base Mix and the piece of rock sugar. Bring the broth to a boil then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer the broth for 2 ½ hours.
In the meantime, slice the cabbage. Set aside.
Peel the carrots and slice the carrots about ½” wide. Set aside.

Also peel the potatoes and cut them into chunks. Place them in a large bowl and pour in enough cold water to cover them. Then add in 1 tablespoon of salt. Keep them in the salted water until ready to use. Once you are ready to add them into the soup, give them a quick rinse. Keeping them in the salted water will prevent them from turning brown. Set aside.
Chop the cilantro and green onions. Set aside.
Occasionally skim the surface of the broth during the entire cooking process to remove any suds or impurities.
After 2 ½ hours of simmering the broth, remove the vegetables from the pot. Scoop out the onions, slices of ginger and garlic cloves . Allow to cool then discard them.
Then pour in 3 cups of distilled water.
Add the carrots to the pot, bring to a boil then reduce the heat to medium-low and continue to simmer the broth for 10 minutes.

After the 10 minutes, add in the potatoes. Bring the broth to a boil then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 30 minutes more. Only cook the potatoes until they are tender. Be careful not to overcook the potatoes otherwise they will become mushy.
Add the sliced cabbage and cook for 5 minutes or until softened.
Add 1 1/2 tablespoons of fish sauce to the broth.
Check on the meat and vegetables to see if they are tender. Then taste and adjust the soup to your liking.

Once the soup is done cooking, ladle it into a bowl and top the soup with some chopped green onions, chopped cilantro, crispy fried shallots and a sprinkle of black pepper. I like to serve the soup over some white rice but you can also serve it with white rice on the side instead if you prefer.
Serve with a soy sauce dip. In a small bowl, pour in some Maggi Seasoning and add some chopped Thai chilis.

Notes: Taste and adjust the soup to your liking. If the soup is too bland, add more salt or Totole Chicken Soup Base Mix. If you’d like, you can replace the cabbage with broccoli. The oxtail was purchased at Costco.

name: Vietnamese Green Papaya Salad With Beef Jerky
summary: Vietnamese Green Papaya Salad With Beef Jerky – Gỏi Đu Đủ Khô Bò is a refreshing and savory salad that combines crisp shredded green papaya with sweet sesame beef jerky, fragrant Thai basil, and crunchy roasted peanuts. Finished with a squeeze of spicy Sriracha, this simple yet bold-flavored dish is a beloved Vietnamese street food perfect as an appetizer or light meal.
ingredients: 1 Package Bach Cuc Sweet Sesame Beef Jerky (Red Package)
A Squeeze of Sriracha Hot Sauce
steps: Make the DRESSING for this Vietnamese Green Papaya Salad. (The recipe is available on my website at www.EatWithEmily.com!)
Cut off the ends of the papaya so that you can stand it up. Then using a knife peel the papaya.
Shred the papaya using a vegetable peeler. Shred it down to the core and discard the seeds on the inside of the papaya.
Place the strands into an ice bath. If you are not going to use all of the papaya then keep the rest in the ice bath. Just cover and store in the fridge. It will keep this way for a few days.
When ready to use place the shredded papaya into a colander and rinse under cold water. Then squeeze the excess water out of them and set them aside to dry.
Wash the Thai Basil, pluck the leaves and then give them a rough chop or you can just tear them apart with your hands. Set aside.
If you are using pre-packaged crushed peanuts than skip this next step. If you are using whole roasted peanuts than you will first need to remove the red skin. Pour the peanuts into a colander.
Place a bowl or plate underneath the colander to catch the peanut skins.
Grab a handful of peanuts and rub them between your two hands.

Once all of the skins have fallen down into the colander give the colander a few shakes. The skins will then fall through the holes of the colander and into the bowl. You can then discard the peanut skins.
Pour the skinless peanuts into a zip loc bag and then seal it. Use a rolling pin or any canned food from your cupboard to crush the peanuts.
Once the peanuts have been crushed pour them back into its original container for storage.
Assemble the salad. Place some of the shredded papaya into a dish.
Then add a few handfuls of the chopped Thai Basil and sprinkle some of the crushed roasted peanuts onto the salad.
Next add on a few handfuls of the Sweet Sesame Beef Jerky.
Then drizzle some of the Vietnamese Green Papaya Salad DRESSING on top of the salad. Toss the salad well.
Next squeeze some Siracha Hot Sauce over the salad and toss. Wait a few minutes for the papaya to absorb the dressing.
Vietnamese Beef Jerky Needed For This Recipe

name: Vietnamese Green Papaya Salad Dressing
vietName: Nước Tương Gỏi Đu Đủ Khô Bò
summary: This savory and tangy Vietnamese Green Papaya Salad Dressing is the perfect companion to Gỏi Đu Đủ Khô Bò. Made with a flavorful blend of Maggi seasoning, rice vinegar, sugar, garlic, and a touch of chili heat, this sauce brings the signature sweet, salty, and spicy balance to your papaya salad. Drizzle it generously over shredded green papaya, herbs, and beef jerky for an authentic and refreshing Vietnamese street food experience.
ingredients: 2 Cloves Garlic or 1 Tablespoon Fresh Minced Garlic
steps: Pour the Maggi Seasoning into a bowl.
Unseasoned Rice Vinegar, and sugar. Stir to dissolve the sugar.
Add in the water, Vegetarian Soya Sauce, minced garlic, and the siracha hot sauce or chili paste. Stir to combine.
Leave on the counter for 30 minutes to an hour before serving to allow the flavors to meld.
This is a dressing for the Vietnamese Green Papaya Salad With Beef Jerky.

name: Green Papaya Salad With Shrimp
summary: Green Papaya Salad With Shrimp is a vibrant Vietnamese dish that combines crisp shredded green papaya and carrots with tender shrimp, fresh herbs, and a punchy fish sauce dressing. Topped with crunchy fried shallots and roasted peanuts, this refreshing salad offers a perfect balance of textures and flavors—ideal as a light meal or a flavorful appetizer.
ingredients: 1 Large Carrot (Peeled and Shredded into 3" Strands)
Vietnamese Fish Sauce Dipping Sauce (Recipe available at www.EatWithEmily.com)
A Handful of Chopped Roasted Peanuts
steps: Make the Vietnamese Fish Sauce Dipping Sauce. Recipe is available on my website at www.EatWithEmily.com
Cook the shrimp. Add 5 cups of water and 1/2 a tablespoon of Totole Chicken Base Mix to a saucepan and bring it to a boil.
Drop in the shrimp and reduce the heat to medium.
Boil the shrimp for about 2-3 minutes or until they are pink.
Drain and give the shrimp a quick rinse under some cold water. Pat dry then slice the shrimps in half and set aside.
Then shred it down to the core. Discard the core.
Immediately place the shredded papaya into an ice bath and keep it in there until needed.
Rinse the shredded papaya under some cold water then squeeze any excess water. Place in a colander to dry.
Place the shredded papaya in a bowl and toss in the shredded carrots to combine.
Add in 1/4 cup of the Vietnamese Fish Sauce Dipping Sauce and toss the salad.
Rough chop the mint leaves, coriander leaves and Thai Basils.

Add in about 2 handfuls each of the herbs but only do so right before you serve the salad otherwise the herbs will quickly wilt. If you are not going to immediately serve the salad then hold off on adding the herbs until then. Toss the salad.
Then plate the papaya salad. You can drizzle on more of the Vietnamese Fish Sauce Dipping Sauce or serve it on the side. Top with some fried shallots and crushed roasted peanuts.

Note: Boiled pork is traditionally added to this recipe but I had chosen to omit it to make it a bit healthier. If you would like, you can boil either pork shoulder or pork butt in some water with a tablespoon of salt. Add enough water to cover the pork.  Simmer for about 45 minutes until it is cooked through.  Let cool and slice thin. Then add it to the papaya salad making sure that the pork is at least at room temperature.

name: Peanut Sauce for Spring Rolls
summary: This easy and flavorful Peanut Sauce for Spring Rolls is the perfect dipping companion for fresh Vietnamese rolls. Made with a creamy blend of hoisin sauce, peanut butter, and a hint of sweetness, it's finished with your choice of toppings like hot sauce, crushed peanuts, or pickled vegetables for added depth and crunch.
ingredients: Hot Sauce, Chili Paste, or Sriracha
steps: In a saucepan on Low heat add in the Hoisin sauce.
Also add in the peanut butter.
Pour in the water and stir to combine. Pork stock can also be used instead of water but the recipe will have to be slightly adjusted.
Add in the sugar and stir to dissolve.
Once everything is well combined turn the heat up to Medium-Low and bring the sauce to a simmer. Stir occasionally to prevent the sauce from burning. The sauce will begin to thicken.
Turn off the heat once it has the desired thickness.
Spoon into a small dipping bowl and add some hot sauce (optional). You can use either the chili paste or siracha hot sauce.
Top with some chopped roasted peanuts.
And also top with some pickled carrots & daikons (optional).

Notes: Taste and adjust the sauce. If the sauce is too salty or too thick for your liking then simply add more water. If the sauce is too thin then add more peanut butter or hoisin sauce. Cover and refrigerate any leftovers.  Reheat the sauce in the microwave before serving.

name: Pickled Beansprouts
summary: This Pickled Beansprouts recipe is a crisp and tangy Vietnamese side dish that pairs perfectly with savory meals. Fresh beansprouts and Chinese garlic chives are quickly pickled in a sweet and sour brine made with vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper. Stored in a 2-quart container, it’s a refreshing and easy condiment that adds crunch and brightness to any plate.
ingredients: 1 Bag Beansprouts (24 oz – Use Half the Bag)
1/2 Bunch Chinese Garlic Chives (About 2 Cups, Cut into 2" Sections)
steps: Wash the beansprouts and chinese garlic chives.
Cut the chinese garlic chives into 2'' sections.
Gently toss the beansprouts and the chinese chives together in a colander.
Fill a canister with the mixed beansprouts and chinese chives. Set aside.
Make the brine. Pour 2 cups of water into a bowl and heat it in the microwave for 2 minutes.
Then add in the sugar and stir to dissolve. Also add in the salt and black pepper. Stir to combine.
Pour the brine into the canister with the mixed beansprouts and chinese chives. The brine does not have to completely fill the canister as the beansprouts will reduce in volume.
Use a spoon to gently press the beansprouts and chinese chives down into the brine.
Cover with a lid and place on the counter for 45 minutes to an hour.
I will usually serve this along with the Vietnamese Carmelized Fish.

Notes: The longer the beansprouts sit in the brine the softer it will become. Do not store until the next day as it will become too soft. I suggest that you serve it about an hour after the initial brining.

name: Pork And Vegetable Soup
vietName: Canh Sườn Nấu Bông Cải Khoai Tây
summary: Warm, hearty, and nourishing, this Pork and Vegetable Soup is a comforting Vietnamese dish made with tender pork spare ribs simmered in a savory broth flavored with chicken soup base, salt, and vegetables. Loaded with carrots, potatoes, cabbage, and broccoli, this soup is both filling and healthy. It’s commonly served with a sprinkle of black pepper, fresh herbs like cilantro and green onions, and a spicy Maggi dipping sauce with Thai chili peppers for extra kick. Perfect for a wholesome family meal.
ingredients: 3 Tablespoons Totole Chicken Soup Base Mix
2 Pounds Pork Spare Ribs (Cut into Smaller Pieces)
2 Large Carrots (Peeled and Cut into Bite-Sized Pieces)
3 Idaho Potatoes (Peeled and Cut into Bite-Sized Pieces)
1/2 Head of Small Cabbage (Sliced into Strips, About 6 Cups)
1 Small Head of Broccoli (Cut into Florets, or 15 oz Pre-Cut Package)
steps: Peel and slice the carrot. Set aside.
Peel and cut the potatoes into bite size pieces.
Place the potatoes in a bowl filled with water and 1/2 a tablespoon of salt to keep the potatoes from browning. Set aside until needed.
Cut the broccoli into florets. Set aside.
Cut the cabbage into strips. You will need 6 cups of sliced cabbage. Set aside.
( Optional ) Chop the cilantro and green onions for garnishing. Set aside.
Cut the spare ribs into smaller pieces.
Wash the spare ribs with warm water about 4-5 times until the water is no longer as cloudy. Drain.
Fill a large stock pot with water. Add the salt and the Totole Chicken Soup Base Mix. Stir and bring to a boil.
Carefully lower the spare ribs into the pot.
Cover the pot with a lid but leave a small gap. Bring to a boil.
Once the soup has come to a boil, remove any scum from the top of the soup. Cover with a lid again leaving a small gap and reduce the heat. Simmer the spare ribs for 15 minutes.
Next add in the carrots. Cover slightly and bring the soup back to a boil. Then reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Drain the potatoes and give them a quick rinse to remove any salt. Then add them to the pot. Cover slightly and bring the soup back to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
And also add in the broccoli. Cook both the cabbage and broccoli for 5 minutes.
Then turn off the heat, cover slightly and allow the soup to sit on the stove for 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
Ladle the soup into a bowl and sprinkle on some black pepper.

Serve with a side of rice or you can ladle the soup directly over some rice. Also serve with a dipping sauce for the pork. Pour some Maggi Seasoning into a small bowl. Slice a Thai Chili pepper or two and add it to the bowl.
(Optional) Garnish with some chopped green onions and cilantro. Or you can garnish with some fried shallots. Your choice.

When covering the pot, remember to always leave a small gap. After you add in the pork, carrots and potatoes you will need to bring the soup back to a boil each time as any additions to the soup will reduce the heat. Just remember to reduce the  heat afterwards and keep the soup at a simmer.
Through out the entire cooking process, be sure to skim off any scum or foam from the top of the soup.
At the end, taste and adjust your soup. If it is too salty, add more water. If it needs more flavor add some chicken seasoning or salt.

name: Pork Omelette
summary: This Pork Omelette is a flavorful Vietnamese-style dish packed with seasoned ground pork, eggs, and a medley of aromatics like garlic, shallots, and green onions. Enhanced with soaked vermicelli noodles and black fungus mushrooms, the filling is both hearty and texturally rich. It's pan-fried to golden perfection, making it a satisfying dish that’s quick enough for a weeknight meal yet special enough to serve guests.
ingredients: 1 Teaspoon Totole Chicken Flavor Base Mix
1/4 Cup Pre-Shredded Dried Black Fungus Mushrooms (Soak and Chop – Use 2 Tablespoons Chopped)
1 Bundle Vermicelli Bean Thread Noodles (Soak and Chop – Use 1/4 Cup Chopped)
steps: Place the dried black fungus mushrooms and the bean thread noodles each into its own bowl.
Then fill the bowls with hot boiling water. Let the mushrooms and noodles soak in the hot water for 10 minutes.

Drain the mushrooms and noodles. Then rough chop them . Measure out 2 tablespoons of the chopped black fungus mushrooms and 1/4 cup of the chopped bean thread noodles as that is the amount needed for this recipe. Discard the rest or save any extra mushrooms or noodles for another recipe. Then set both ingredients aside.
In a bowl combine the ground pork with the fish sauce, garlic salt, sugar, Totole Chicken Flavor Base Mix, black pepper, minced garlic, chopped shallots and chopped green onions.
Also add in the chopped mushrooms and chopped noodles. Mix to combine.
Lastly crack in 3 eggs into the pork mixture.
Use a fork to mix the eggs into the pork mixture.
In a skillet on Medium-High heat add a tablespoon of cooking oil.
Once the oil is hot, pour in the pork mixture and immediately reduce the heat to Medium Low. Use a spoon or spatula to spread the pork mixture out evenly onto the pan.
Cover and cook the omelette for about 6 minutes or until the bottom of the omelette is browned.
Just before flipping the omelette over to the other side, sprinkle some black pepper onto the omelette.
Then flip the omelette over and cook it UNCOVERED this time for about 5-6 minutes or until once again the bottom of the omelette is browned.
Transfer to a plate and serve with white rice.

name: Puff Pastry Pies - Pate Chaud
summary: This recipe for Puff Pastry Pies - Pate Chaud - Bánh Patê Sô is a Vietnamese take on savory French-inspired meat pies. Flaky, buttery puff pastry is filled with a savory mixture of ground pork, fish sauce, onions, garlic, mushrooms, and peas and carrots, then baked to golden perfection. These hand-held pies are perfect as a snack, appetizer, or light meal and are especially popular during holidays and gatherings.
ingredients: 2 Boxes Frozen Pepperidge Farm Puff Pastry Sheets (17.3 oz each – Makes 9 Bánh Patê Sô per box)
3 Egg Yolks (Beaten – Do Not Use Egg Whites)
Set of 3 Round Fluted Cookie Cutters (Small, Medium, Large)
steps: Place the box of puff pastry sheets on the counter to defrost for 30-40 minutes. Do not leave on the counter for longer than that as the dough will be too soft to work with. If it becomes too soft just place it back in the freezer to harden again.

Rehydrate the Shitake mushrooms. Pour some water into a tea kettle and just before it comes to a boil, turn off the heat. Place 4 shitake mushrooms in a bowl and pour in the hot water. Let sit for 20-25 minutes until the mushrooms are rehydrated. Drain, give them a quick rinse under some cold water and squeeze out the excess water with your hands.
Dice the mushrooms. Discard the tough stems. Set aside.
Defrost the frozen carrots & peas. Pour the carrots & peas into a bowl and add the boiling water from the tea kettle. Let stand for 5 minutes. minutes. Drain and set aside.
Marinate the ground pork. Combine the ground pork with the fish sauce, garlic salt, black pepper, sugar, Maggi Seasoning, and chicken seasoning. Mix with your hands.
Then toss in the chopped onions, chopped garlic, carrots & peas and diced Shitake mushrooms. Mix to combine.
Take a handful of the All Purpose flour and spread it onto your work space.
Then unfold the puff pastry sheet and place it onto your cutting board.

Use the ( Large ) 3'' inch round cookie cutter to cut out 9 circles. If you wish, you can use a rolling pin to flatten the scraps to make one more puff pastry pie. Otherwise, you can just discard the scraps of dough.

Lay the cut out rounds onto a baking tray lined with parchment paper and place the small cookie cutter in the center of the circle. Gently press down on the cookie cutter to make a slight indention in the dough. This will be your guide for your meat mixture.

Place 1 1/2 tablespoons of the meat mixture in the center of the circle. Please note that the meat will decrease slightly in size as it cooks so 1 1/2 tablespoons of the meat mixture should be sufficient.
Crack 3 eggs and separate the egg yolks from the egg whites. Beat the egg yolks and set aside. Do not discard and waste the egg whites. You can make an omelet with them. 🙂
Dip your finger into the beaten egg yolks and rub it along the edges of the circle.
Sprinkle some black pepper over the meat mixture for the last time. Then momentarily set them aside.
Take the second pastry sheet out of the box and again cut out 9 circles.
Use a fork to poke some holes through the dough. Steam must be allowed to escape otherwise your Bánh Patê Sô will turn out lopsided and too puffy.
Lay the round dough on top of the meat mixture and use your fingers to press down along the edges of the circle to seal them.
Use the medium (just about 2 1/2'') round cookie cutter to press down around the center of the meat mixture to create a ring around it.
Brush the egg wash onto the pastry.
Then transfer to the oven and place on the middle rack. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
Once they are golden brown turn off the heat and leave them inside the oven with the door closed for an additional 20 minutes.
Best to serve immediately while still warm.

name: Rice Noodle Stir Fry With Beef
summary: This Rice Noodle Stir Fry With Beef (Phở Xào Thịt Bò) is a savory and satisfying Vietnamese dish featuring tender marinated slices of beef stir-fried with fresh vegetables like bok choy, carrots, tomatoes, and onions. It’s all tossed together with chewy rice noodles and a rich homemade stir-fry sauce made from fish sauce, Maggi seasoning, oyster sauce, and sesame oil.
ingredients: 10 Medium-Sized Shiitake Mushrooms (Soaked in Hot Water for 20 Minutes, Cut into Thirds)
1 Pound Eye Round Beef (Thinly Sliced – About 40 Slices)
1 Large Carrot (Thinly Sliced at an Angle)
9 Bunches Bok Choy (About 3 Handfuls, Cut into 1-Inch Strips)
For the stir-fry sauce (Split – 4 Tablespoons for Noodles, Rest for Veggies)
steps: Place the shitake mushrooms in a bowl and fill it with some hot water. Soak for 20 minutes.
Drain and give the mushrooms a quick rinse. Then gently squeeze out some of the excess water with your hands.
Slice the mushrooms into thirds. Remove and discard the stems. Then set aside.
Cut the pre-sliced beef in half.

Marinate the beef. Place beef in a bowl then add ½ a tablespoon of fish sauce, 1/2 teaspoon dark soy sauce, ½ teaspoon of garlic salt, ⅛ teaspoon of black pepper, ½ teaspoon of sugar and 1 teaspoon of cornstarch. Gently mix with your hands.
Then add in the minced garlic and mix again. Set aside.
Prepare the vegetables. Thinly slice the carrots at a diagonal.
Remove and discard the stems of the bok choy. Then cut into 1 inch strips and set aside the veggies.

If your noodles were refrigerated at the time of purchase then you will need to slightly warm them up to be able to separate them. Process with the following steps. If you had purchased your noodles and they are already soft and at room temperature then you can skip this step. Place the refrigerated noodles on a plate and microwave for 2 minutes.
Then place another plate on top of the noodles and flip the noodles over.
Remove the upper plate and microwave for 1 more minute. Afterwards the noodles should still be a bit stiff.
Place the noodles in a large mixing bowl and use your hands to separate the noodles. Set aside.

Make the stir fry sauce. In a bowl add 1 tablespoon fish sauce, 1 teaspoon dark soy sauce, 2 tablespoons maggi seasoning , 3 tablespoons oyster sauce, 2 teaspoons sugar, 4 tablespoons water, 1 teaspoon white vinegar and ½ teaspoon of sesame oil. Stir and set aside.

Heat a wok until smoking hot. Then add in 2 1/2 tablespoons of oil. Add in the minced garlic and noodles. Give it a quick toss then let the noodles sit undisturbed in the pan for about a minute or two or until the noodles are slightly crispy.

Then toss the noodles and add 4 tablespoons of the stir fry sauce to the pan. Once the noodles are coated with the sauce, turn off the heat and transfer the noodles to a large platter. Then give the wok a quick wipe.

Cook the beef in the same wok. Heat it up until smoking hot. Then add 2 tablespoons of oil and once the oil is hot, add in the beef . Separate the beef into one layer. Leave the beef undisturbed for 1 minute or so to allow it to brown. Then toss for a few seconds and cook until the beef is about 70% done. Do not cook the beef all the way otherwise it will be tough and dry.
Then transfer the cooked beef to a plate and set aside. Do not clean out the wok.
Cook the vegetables in the same wok. Turn the heat on to medium and add in 2 tablespoons of oil. Once the oil is hot add in the carrots and shitake mushrooms. Cook for 2 minutes .
Then add in the onions and if the bottom of the pan is dry add another tablespoon of vegetable oil. Cook for another 2 minutes.
Now reduce the heat to medium low and add in the tomatoes as well as the rest of the stir fry sauce. Cook for another 2 minutes.
Lastly, add in the bok choy and cook the bok choy until it is wilted.
Keep the heat on medium low . Return the noodles and beef to the wok. Mix to coat the noodles and beef with the sauce. Once the noodles and beef are heated through, turn off the heat.
Sprinkle on some black pepper. If you want, you can squirt some siracha and hoisin sauce over the noodles .
Or you can serve the hoisin sauce and siracha on the side for dipping.
Below are some brands used in this recipe:

name: How To Boil Rice Noodles
summary: Learn how to properly cook rice stick noodles to achieve the perfect texture for Vietnamese dishes like spring rolls. This step-by-step guide covers boiling, rinsing, and drying techniques to prevent stickiness and ensure your noodles stay fresh and ready to use.
steps: Fill a large stock pot with water and bring it to a rolling boil.
In the meantime place a colander in the sink with a bowl under it and fill it with some cold water.

Once the water in the pot has come to a boil add in the noodles. You may need to split up your noodles and cook them in 2 batches if your pot is not very big. There needs to be enough water in the pot to completely submerse the noodles and enough room for them to move around freely. If there is not enough water in your pot the noodles may turn out sticky.
Let the water come back to a boil. Once it has come back to a boil slightly reduce the heat so that it does not boil over.
Use your chopsticks and gently separate the noodles a bit.

After cooking the noodles for about 3 to 4 minutes check to see if they are done. Taste for tenderness. Be careful not to overcook the noodles as they can break apart easily and can become mushy. The noodles should only take about 5 minutes to cook.
Once the noodles are about 95% done cooking turn off the heat and cover the pot with a lid. Let the noodles sit in the pot for 1 minute.
Drain the noodles then dump the noodles into the colander bowl filled with cold water. Use your hands or chop sticks to swish the noodles around a bit to remove any starch.
Rinse the noodles under some cold running water 3-4 times until the water turns clear.
Next fill the colander bowl with some hot tap water. Once the noodles feel warm, turn off the water and drain.

If you have cooked an entire package of noodles then it is best to split the noodles into 2 colanders to allow them to air dry . If you just use one colander then the noodles on top will dry and the other half on the bottom will still be wet. Make 4 mounds of noodles in each colander . Doing this will prevent one big clump of noodles and will make it easier for you to remove them from the colander.
Place on the counter for 30 to 45 minutes to air dry. Come back every 5 minutes or so to fluff up the noodles .
Once they are completely dry, you can place them in a plastic container and cover with a lid for later use. You can keep them this way for a few hours.

Once you are ready to use the noodles, if they are cold you can microwave them for 30 seconds to a minute to bring them back to room temperature. These rice stick noodles can be used for Vietnamese Spring Rolls and many other Vietnamese dishes!

name: Vietnamese Roasted Catfish
summary: Vietnamese Roasted Catfish (Cá Nướng Da Giòn) features a whole butterflied catfish roasted until the skin is crispy and golden. It's brushed with a honey-butter glaze and served with scallion oil, roasted peanuts, and fried shallots. This dish is traditionally enjoyed with rice paper, fresh herbs, and vegetables, accompanied by a bold and tangy anchovy dipping sauce (mắm nêm) for wrapping and dipping. Perfect for a shared family-style meal.
ingredients: For scallion oil (microwave in a bowl)
For the anchovy dipping sauce (Mắm Nêm)
1 Bottle Pagolac Mam Nem (12.5 fl oz)
2–3 Teaspoons Chili Paste (or Fresh Chopped Thai Chilis)
For serving with a vegetable platter
1 Package Dried Rice Paper Sheets (Bánh Tráng)
steps: Make the anchovy dipping sauce. In a bowl combine the Pagolac Mam nem with the sugar, fish sauce, fresh lime juice, minced garlic, minced lemongrass, crushed pineapples and chili paste ( or substitute with fresh chopped thai chili ). Set aside.
Prep your platter of vegetables. Wash the lettuce and herbs. Thinly slice the cucumbers. Then set aside.
Chop the scallions and dump into a bowl. Pour in the vegetable oil and add 2-3 pinches of salt. Microwave for 1 minute and set aside.
Clean the fish then score it on both sides.
Brush some cooking oil all over the skin of the fish on both sides.
Place the stick of butter in a bowl and cover with a plate to prevent splatter. Microwave until melted. Then brush some butter all over the skin of the fish on both sides.
Sprinkle some garlic salt and black pepper on both sides of the fish.
Open up the fish and brush some butter all over the belly then sprinkle on some garlic salt and black pepper.
Coat a grill/broiler pan set with vegetable oil . Coat the top grill and also the bottom drip pan to prevent sticking or smoking during the baking process.
Place the fish flat onto the grill pan with the skin side up. Transfer the pan to the oven and place on the top rack. Bake for 20 minutes.
Then slightly pull out the grill pan. Brush some vegetable oil and butter onto the fish. Bake for 20 minutes more.
Slightly pull out the grill pan and brush a thin layer of honey onto the skin of the fish. Bake 15 minutes more.

Now increase the temperature to BROIL . At this point, you must keep a careful eye on the fish otherwise it may quickly burn ! Each oven is different so roasting time may vary. It should only take a few minutes for the skin to turn brown. Remove the fish from the oven once it has turned brown and crispy! Re-heat the bowl of scallions from earlier for 30 seconds. Then spread the scallions all over the fish. Try to scoop out just the scallions and leave behind any excess oil in the bowl. Discard the oil. Top the fish with some of the Lee Brand Fried Red Onions and crushed roasted peanuts.

When you are ready to serve your delicious fish, dip your rice paper into some warm water and lay it on a plate. Then add your lettuce, herbs, sliced cucumbers, pickled daikon and carrots ( optional ) and a spoonful of roasted fish . If you'd like, you can also add some vermicelli rice noodles to your roll!
Roll the bottom of the rice paper up, then the sides and roll the rest of the way.
Dip your roll into the anchovy dipping sauce and enjoy!
Notes: If you buy a fish of a different weight approximate baking time is 10-12 minutes per pound.

name: Sauteed Pea Sprouts
vietName: Rau Đậu Hoà Lan Xào Tỏi
summary: Sauteed Pea Sprouts is a quick and flavorful Vietnamese side dish made by stir-frying fresh pea sprouts with garlic in vegetable oil, then simmering them in a savory mix of water, chicken soup base, and fish sauce. Finished with a dash of black pepper, it’s a light and delicious accompaniment to any meal.
ingredients: 1 Tablespoon Totole Chicken Flavor Soup Base Mix
steps: In a saute pan add the cooking oil and turn the heat on to Medium-High.
Once the oil is warmed up add the minced garlic to the pan and saute for about 10 seconds.
Then add in the pea sprouts and give it a toss.
Also add in the chicken seasoning. Then give the pea sprouts another toss.
Add in the fish sauce and saute the pea sprouts until slightly wilted.
As soon as the pea sprouts have wilted immediately turn off the heat otherwise you may overcook the pea sprouts.
Give it a sprinkle of black pepper and serve immediately.
Total cooking time is about 3-4 minutes as the pea sprouts cook down fairly quickly.

name: Shaking Beef
summary: Shaking Beef – Bò Lúc Lắc features tender cubes of marinated steak quickly seared in a hot cast iron skillet for a flavorful crust. The beef is seasoned with a savory mix of fish sauce, Maggi, oyster sauce, and garlic, then served over a fresh salad of lettuce, tomato, onion, and cilantro. A tangy vinaigrette dressing balances the richness of the meat, making this Vietnamese classic both bold and refreshing.
ingredients: 1 Pound Steak (Rib-eye or Filet Mignon, Cut into Bite-Sized Pieces)
1 Head Red Leaf Lettuce (Torn into Bite-Sized Pieces)
steps: Marinate the beef with fish sauce, Maggi Seasoning, oyster sauce, garlic salt, sugar and black pepper. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or more.
Thinly slice the onion and set aside.

Make the vinaigrette dressing. In a bowl pour in the warm water and add in the sugar. Stir to dissolve. Then also add in the unseasoned rice vinegar, black pepper and salt. Stir then place the thinly sliced onions in the vinaigrette dressing.
Cover and place on the counter for at least 1 hour.
Prepare the salad plate. Put some lettuce on the plate first.
Also add the thinly sliced onions from the vinaigrette dressing.
And then place the cilantro in the center of the salad. Drizzle some of the vinaigrette dressing onto the salad and set aside.

Place a cast iron skillet on the stove and turn the heat on to High. Once the skillet is hot add a tablespoon of cooking oil. Wait a minute for the oil to get hot then add in the beef. Do not over crowd the pan. If you have a small skillet then cook in two batches.
Spread the beef out in a single layer and do not stir. Leave the beef alone for a minute or two until it has browned then flip the beef over.

Once the beef has been flipped over again do not stir the beef. Cook for 1 minute then add in the minced garlic. Still do not stir yet for another 30 seconds to a minute. Then give the beef a toss and add in the un-salted butter.
Toss again and cook until the butter has melted.
Transfer the beef to the salad plate and serve immediately.

name: Spring Rolls With Chinese Sausages (Bo Bia)
summary: Spring Rolls With Chinese Sausages (Bò Bía) is a savory Vietnamese snack made with dried shrimp, Chinese sausage, sautéed jicama, eggs, and fresh herbs, all wrapped in rice paper. These flavorful rolls are served with pickled vegetables and a rich peanut dipping sauce for a perfect balance of sweet, salty, and umami.
ingredients: 5 Chinese Sausage Links (Thinly Sliced at a Slight Angle)
1 Package Rice Paper (20 oz, Medium Size, ~9 Inches in Diameter)
1 Head Green or Red Leaf Lettuce
Vietnamese Peanut Dipping Sauce (See Recipe at www.EatWithEmily.com)
steps: Fill a tea kettle with some water and bring to a boil.
Place the dried shrimps in a bowl and fill it with the hot water from the tea kettle. Let soak for 10 minutes. Drain and give the shrimp a quick rinse.
In a pan on Medium High heat add 1/2 a tablespoon of vegetable oil. .
Saute the dried shrimps for 3-4 minutes until slightly browned.
Then pour onto a plate lined with paper towels to drain the excess oil. Set aside.
Next work on the chinese sausages.
Thinly slice the chinese sausages at an angle.

In a dry pan ( do no add any oil ) on Medium-High heat add in the sliced sausages. Saute for about 4-5 minutes or until slightly crispy. Do not cook them for too long as they will curl up. Remove them from the pan right before they start to curl on the ends.
Pour onto a plate lined with paper towels to drain the excess oil. Set aside.
Peel the jicama with a vegetable peeler or knife.
Then julienne into match stick sized strips.
In a saute pan on Medium heat add in 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil. Once the oil is hot add in the minced garlic and saute for 15 seconds. Then add in the julienned jicama.
Toss the jicama and add in the fried shallots.
Saute for 5-7 minutes or until the jicama is slightly wilted but still crunchy. Pour into a bowl and set aside.

Beat the eggs. You will need to cook the eggs in 3-4 batches. In a pan on Medium heat add 1/2 a tablespoon of vegetable oil. Add a thin layer of the beaten eggs into the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes or until the bottom of the eggs is dry. Season with salt and black pepper (optional ). Then flip the omellete over and immediately turn off the heat.
Remove from the pan and place onto a cutting board.
Roll the omelete up and cut into thin strips.

Right before you wrap the spring rolls re-heat the chinese sausages in the microwave for 20 seconds and re-heat the julienned jicama for 30 seconds to a minute. Do not make them too hot as they will wilt the Thai Basil . Just slightly warm them up or bring them to room temperature.

Take a rice paper and dip it into some cool or warm water. Lay it on a plate and add the fillings. Place the lettuce at the bottom of the rice paper and add a few of the Thai Basils on top it. Next add a row of the julienned jicama, a row of the dried shrimps, a row of egg strips and at the very top row should be the sliced chinese sausages.
Pull the bottom of the rice paper up and over the filling.
Then fold in the sides. It will look like an envelope.
Then roll upward to complete the roll.
Serve with a Vietnamese Peanut Dipping Sauce. Recipe is available on my website at www.EatWithEmily.com
Top the sauce with some pickled carrots & daikons (optional) .

name: Vietnamese Steamed Egg Meatloaf
summary: Chả Trứng is a traditional Vietnamese steamed egg meatloaf that’s both savory and satisfying. This version combines ground pork, vermicelli bean thread noodles, and black fungus for texture, seasoned with fish sauce, garlic, shallots, and pepper. The mixture is bound together with eggs and steamed until firm, then optionally glazed with a vibrant annatto seed oil for added color. It’s a classic comfort dish often served with rice or in combination plates.
ingredients: 1 Teaspoon Totole Chicken Flavor Base Mix
1 Bundle Vermicelli Bean Thread Noodles (Use 1/2 Cup, Roughly Chopped)
7 Large Cage-Free Eggs (Separate – Reserve 4 Yolks for Glaze)
steps: Soak the black fungus and noodles in hot water for 10 minutes.
Combine the pork with fish sauce, sugar, garlic salt, Totole Chicken Base Mix, black pepper, chopped garlic, chopped dried black fungus, and chopped vermicelli bean thread nooodles .
Have 2 bowls ready. In one medium sized bowl crack 7 eggs but RESERVE 4 egg yolks for the egg glaze. Beat the 7 eggs and place the 4 eggs yolks in a smaller bowl.
Add 1/4 teaspoon of fish sauce to the 4 egg yolks and beat the eggs. Set aside for the glaze.
Then add the eggs to the pork mixture.
Place a steaming rack in the center of a wok and add some water. Bring to a boil.
Coat the bottom and sides of a pie plate with some vegetable oil.
Pour the egg mixture into the pie plate. Even out the top of the egg meatloaf.
Once the water has come to a boil, place the egg meatloaf onto the steaming rack.
Cover with a lid with a vent hole and REDUCE the heat to medium. Steam for 30 minutes.
During the steaming process if water should drip onto the egg meatloaf due to condensation, use a paper towel and dab the top of the egg meatloaf to dry it.
Once it has steamed for 30 minutes, remove the lid and pour the egg glaze over the meatloaf. Use a spoon to spread the glaze evenly over the egg meatloaf.
Then cover and steam for another 5 to 10 minutes until the egg glaze is set.
Remove the egg meatloaf from the wok and let it cool for 15-20 minutes before serving.
Serve with broken rice or jasmine rice.

Notes: You can also add some shrimp, crabmeat, shredded carrots or  chopped green onions to the pork mixture. If you would like to add some color to the top of your egg meat loaf then do the following. You will need to make some annatto seed oil. Turn the heat to medium-high and add the oil to the pan. Once the pan is hot add the annatto seeds. Stir until the seeds have bled most of their color. It should take about 2-3 minutes.  Discard the seeds and reserve the oil. Let the annatto seed oil cool then add it to the 4 beaten egg yolks. Stir.

name: Stir Fry Bitter Melon With Eggs
summary: This simple and nutritious Vietnamese dish, Khổ Qua Xào Trứng, features tender slices of bitter melon stir-fried with fluffy scrambled eggs. Lightly seasoned with fish sauce, black pepper, and green onions, it balances the melon’s distinct bitterness with rich, savory flavors. Quick to prepare and packed with health benefits, this is a comforting everyday dish often served with steamed rice.
steps: Crack the eggs into a small bowl. Beat the eggs and stir in the fish sauce. Then set aside.
In a pan on Medium heat pour in 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil.

Once the oil is hot, dump in the sliced bitter melons. Toss the bitter melons until the pan is dry then add in 1 1/2 tablespoons of water. Cook the bitter melons until the water has disappeared and the pan is once again dry.
Now turn the heat to HIGH and add 1 tablespoon of butter to the pan. Allow the butter to melt.

Toss the bitter melons with the butter then pour in the beaten eggs. Cook the eggs for about a minute or two until the eggs are slightly set then turn the bitter melons and eggs over. Cook for another minute.
Then toss in a handful of chopped green onions.
Stir until the eggs are cooked and the bitter melons are as tender as desired. I prefer the bitter melons to still have a little bit of bite in them.
( Optional ) Serve with a side of fish sauce with some chopped thai chilis. Fill a small dipping bowl with some fish sauce. Chop one red thai chili and add it to the sauce.

name: Stir Fry Noodles
summary: Stir Fry Noodles is a savory and satisfying dish featuring chow mein noodles tossed with marinated beef, crispy fried tofu, and fresh vegetables like bean sprouts and Chinese chives. The beef is thinly sliced and flavored with a blend of fish sauce, oyster sauce, garlic, and Maggi seasoning for a rich, umami taste. The noodles are stir-fried with a touch of sesame oil and garlic salt.
ingredients: 1 Pound Eye of Round Beef (Thinly Sliced)
2 Cups Fried Tofu (Cut into Bite-Sized Pieces, Optional)
steps: Make a spicy soy sauce (Optional). In a bowl combine the Maggi Seasoning, sate sauce, sugar, water and siracha. Stir to combine. Set aside.
Use your hands to tear the thinly sliced beef into 1/2 or 1/3 of its size.

In a bowl combine the beef with the fish sauce, Maggi Seasoning, oyster sauce, sugar, garlic salt, and black pepper. Mix well. Then add in the minced garlic and chopped shallots. Mix again. Marinate for 30 minutes. Set aside.
Wash the bean sprouts and chinese chives. Cut about 1/2 an inch off the bottom of the chinese chives. Then cut into 1'' inch sections. Set the bean sprouts and chinese chives aside.

Fill a pot with some water and bring it to a boil. Once the water has come to a boil add in the noodles. Cook the noodles for about 3 to 4 minutes. Becareful not to over cook the noodles. Drain in a colander and set aside. You do not need to rinse the noodles.
In a pan on High heat add the cooking oil. Once the oil is hot add in the sliced onions. Saute for about 1-2 minutes until they are translucent.
Then add the beef. Spread the beef around the pan and let it cook for about 2-3 minutes undisturbed. Do not stir or flip the meat.
Once the meat has browned, flip the meat over and add in the oyster sauce. Stir and saute the beef until it is about 90% fully cooked.
Turn off the stove and let the residual heat finish cooking the beef. If you over cook your beef it will become tough. Pour the beef into a bowl and set it aside. Do not clean out the pan.

In the same pan add 1 1/2 tablespons of cooking oil and turn the heat on to Medium . Once the oil is hot add in the noodles and fried tofu (optional). Toss the noodles. Then add in the garlic salt, Maggi Seasoning and the sesame oil. Toss the noodles again.
Add in the bean sprouts and continue to toss the noodles for about 1-2 minutes until the bean sprouts are slightly cooked.
Then throw in the chinese chives and cook for about 1 minute. Return the cooked beef to the pan. Toss to combine.
Return the cooked beef to the pan and toss to combine.
Transfer to a plate. Sprinkle on some black pepper and garnish with cilantro.

Drizzle some of the spicy soy sauce over the noodles. If you do not wish to make the spicy soy sauce you can pour some Maggi Seasoning into a bowl and just add in some chopped Thai chilis . If you cannot eat spicy foods then you can just drizzle some Maggi Seasoning over the noodles.
If you'd like you can also add some shrimp to this recipe! This is the brand of noodles that I had used in this recipe.
This is the sa-te that was used for the spicy soy sauce.

name: Stuffed Bell Peppers
summary: Stuffed Bell Peppers is a flavorful Vietnamese dish made by filling halved bell peppers with a savory pork mixture seasoned with fish sauce, Maggi, and oyster sauce. The filling includes minced garlic, chopped shallots, black fungus mushrooms, and vermicelli noodles for texture. Once cooked, the peppers are served with white rice and a side of soy sauce with chopped Thai chilis for an added kick.
ingredients: 4 Whole Bell Peppers (Cut in Half – Any Colors)
1 Teaspoon Totole Chicken Flavor Base Mix
1/4 Cup Shredded Black Fungus Mushrooms (About 3 Tablespoons Chopped)
1/3 Bunch Vermicelli Bean Thread Noodles (About 1/2 Cup Cut)
2 Tablespoons Chopped Green Onions (Top Green Section Only)
Soy Sauce with Chopped Thai Chilis
steps: Fill a kettle with water and bring it to a boil.

Place the shredded black fungus mushrooms in a boil and pour in the hot water. Soak the mushrooms for 10 minutes. Drain in a colander. Give it a quick rinse. Then squeeze the mushrooms to remove excess water. Chop into smaller pieces and set aside.
Place the vermicelli bean thread noodles in a bowl and pour in the hot water. Soak for 15 minutes. Drain in a colander. Then cut into 1/2 inch sections. Set aside.
Place the ground pork in a bowl and add in the fish sauce, maggi seasoning, oyster sauce, totole chicken flavor base mix, garlic salt, and black pepper. Mix to combine.
Then add in the chopped black fungus mushrooms and cut vermicelli bean thread noodles. Mix to combine.
Also add in the minced garlic, chopped shallots and chopped green onions. Mix well.
Cut the bell peppers in half. Cut around the stem to remove it from the top half.
Also remove the seeds and membranes on the inside of the bell peppers.
Cut a small hole on the bottom half of the bell pepper so that the meat can cook throughly.
Then lightly stuff the bell peppers.
In a saute pan on Medium High heat pour in the cooking oil.
Once the oil is hot place the bell peppers face down into the pan. Cover with a lid and cook for about 3 minutes or until the top of the meat has browned.
Remove the bell peppers from the pan and drain the liquid at the bottom of the pan. Do not need to wipe the pan clean.

After draining the liquid return the bell peppers to the pan facing up this time and reduce the heat to Medium Low. Cover with the lid and cook for about 7-8 minutes or until the bell peppers are as tender as you like them. You are now done!

Skip this next step if the top of your meat is already nicely browned. If in the beginning the top of the meat did not brown then drain the pan once again. Place the bell peppers over face down. Turn the heat to high, cook uncovered for about 1-2 minutes and it should give you a nice brown top on your bell peppers. Skip this step if the top of you bell peppers are already nicely browned.
Serve with white rice and a side of soy sauce with chopped thai chilis.

name: Sweet & Sour Fish Soup
summary: Sweet & Sour Fish Soup is a vibrant Vietnamese dish known as Canh Chua Ca, featuring tender fish steaks simmered in a tangy tamarind broth. With the sweetness of pineapple, the tartness of tomatoes, and the earthy flavor of lemongrass, it’s balanced with fresh vegetables like okra and taro stems. Garnished with aromatic herbs and crispy fried onions, this comforting soup is traditionally served with steamed rice.
ingredients: 1 Can Pineapple Chunks in 100% Juice (20 oz)
steps: Add 1 1/2 tablespoons of cooking oil to a pan and turn the heat to Medium-High.
Once the oil is hot add the garlic. Saute for 30 seconds.
Then add the lemongrass. Saute for 1 minute.
Add the fish steaks and cook the first side for 3 minutes.
Flip the fish over and cook for 1 minute.
Turn off the heat. Set aside.
Add 12 cups of water to a pot and turn the heat to High.
Add 1 packet of Tamarind powder, 1/3 cup of fish sauce, 1 tablespoon of salt, 1 teaspoon of chicken seasoning, and just about 1 cup of sugar.
Once the broth has come to a boil add the fish.
Leave the heat on High and let the broth come back to a boil.
Then reduce the heat to Medium and simmer the broth for 10 minutes.
Then add the entire can of pineapple chunks (including the juice) and the tomatoes.
Turn the heat back up to High and bring the broth back to a boil once again.
Once the broth has come to a boil reduce the heat to Medium-Low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the taro stems, okra and jalapenos.
Add the beansprouts, rice paddy herb, saw leaf herb and immediately turn off the heat.
Notes: Total simmering time should be 20 to 25 minutes.

name: Tofu and Chinese Chives Soup
vietName: Canh Hẹ Dậu Hũ Thịt Bằm
summary: Tofu and Chinese Chives Soup is a comforting Vietnamese soup featuring seasoned ground pork, soft tofu, and fresh Chinese chives simmered in a flavorful broth. This light yet savory soup is perfect for a nourishing meal and highlights simple, wholesome ingredients with a delicate balance of seasoning.
steps: Season the ground pork with fish sauce, chicken seasoning, garlic salt, black pepper, and shallots. Mix well.
Separate and clump the ground pork into smaller pieces. Set aside.
Cut the Chinese chives into 1 inch in length. Cut off a little bit from the bottom of the chives and discard. Set aside.
Rinse tofu and cut into smaller pieces. Set aside.
Bring a pot of water to boil and add salt
Once the water has come to a boil add the ground pork.
Also add the chicken seasoning. Stir and bring back to a boil.
Remove any foam from the top of the soup.
Once the soup has come to a boil add the chives. Then flip the chives over and remove from heat. Let the soup sit for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Vermicelli Noodles With Lemon Grass Beef
summary: Vermicelli Noodles With Lemongrass Beef is a flavorful Vietnamese dish featuring thinly sliced eye of round beef marinated with fish sauce, Maggi seasoning, garlic salt, black pepper, sugar, and lemongrass. The beef is cooked in batches with garlic, onion, and oyster sauce, then served over rice vermicelli noodles.
ingredients: For cooking the beef (in 2 batches, divide these)
1 Head Red Lettuce or Iceberg Lettuce (Cut into strips)
steps: Boil the noodles and follow the directions on the back of the package. Drain.
Marinate the beef. Place the beef in a bowl and add in the Fish Sauce, soy sauce, garlic salt, black pepper, sugar, lemon grass, vegetable oil. Mix to combine. Let marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Wash and prep all the vegetables. Set aside.
Make the scallion oil. In a saucepan add the cooking oil and turn the heat on to Medium. Once the oil is hot add in the chopped green onions. Give it a stir and turn off the heat. Set aside.

Cook the beef. In a skillet add the cooking oil and turn the heat Medium High. Add in half the garlic and half of the onions. Saute for a minute or so or until the onions are translucent. Then add in half of the beef. The beef will need to be cooked in 2 batches. Do not overcrowd the pan. Cook the beef until about 80% done then add in the oyster sauce. As soon as the beef is no longer pink immediately turn off the stove and remove from heat.

Assemble the bowl. If the noodles are cold then place in a microwave for 30 seconds to a minute to warm it up. Place the noodles on the bottom of the bowl. Then add the lettuce, bean sprouts, perilla, mints, cilantro ,cucumbers, carrots & daikons, beef, and the cooked scallions. Top with the crushed peanuts and fried shallots.
Serve immediately with the Vietnamese Fish Sauce dipping sauce.

Notes: Split half of the beef, garlic, onions and oyster sauce to cook the second batch of beef. When you are ready to assemble your bowl use a fork to scoop out the cooked green onions and leave be sure to leave behind the oil.

name: Vietnamese Mayonaise
summary: This Vietnamese Mayonnaise recipe uses just four simple ingredients: an extra large egg yolk, vegetable oil, salt, and fresh lime juice. Slowly whisking the oil into the yolk by hand creates a rich, creamy mayo with a bright, tangy finish. Perfect as a dip, sandwich spread, or topping for your favorite Vietnamese dishes.
ingredients: 1 Extra Large Organic or Free Range Egg (Yolk Only, Room Temperature)
steps: Crack the egg and separate the egg yolk from the egg white. Do not discard the egg white you can use it to cook an omelet.

Hand whisk the egg yolk. In the beginning slowly add in a few drops at a time. Let the oil slowly bind in with the egg yolk. If you add the oil in too fast the mayonaise will separate. Continuously whisk the egg yolk and add the oil in a little bit at a time. The whole process takes about 10-15 minutes of continuous whisking. One egg yolk can hold up to about 1 cup of oil. The more oil you add the less concentrated the mayo will be. You can add as much oil as you want to get the desired amount of mayo. For one extra large egg I prefer to use only 1/2 cup of oil. As more oil is added the mixture will thicken. Once the mixture has thickened you can pour the oil in a slow and steady stream. Season with a little bit of lime juice and salt. Continue to whisk the mayo until everything is well combined.
Transfer the mayo to an air tight container and it can be stored in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 days.
Notes: This recipe makes 1/2 a cup of mayonaise.

name: Vietnamese Yogurt
summary: This Vietnamese Yogurt recipe creates a creamy, mildly sweet treat made from condensed milk, whole milk, and live culture yogurt. The result is smooth, tangy yogurt with a silky texture that's perfect as a snack or dessert.
ingredients: 6 oz Plain Whole Milk Yogurt (Must Contain 'Live Active Culture')
steps: Pre-heat the oven to 150 degrees for 25 minutes. Then turn it off and keep the oven door closed. Do not open the oven door otherwise you will let the warm air out.
Make the yogurt mixture. Heat up 1 cup of water in a tea kettle and BEFORE the water comes to a boil, turn off the heat. Set aside.
Pour the sweetened condensed milk into a mixing bowl.
Add in the 1 cup of hot water from the tea kettle into the mixing bowl and stir to combine.
Place the cold milk in the microwave for 1 1/2 minutes to bring it to room temperature.
Add the warm milk to the mixture.
Place the cold half & half milk in the microwave for 45 seconds to bring it to room temperature as well.
Then add it to the mixture and stir.
Lastly add in the yogurt . Stir until everything is combined and there are no more lumps.
Should there be any lumps after stirring it for a few minutes, you can strain the mixture through a mesh sieve. If you do not see or feel any lumps then you can skip this step.
Transfer the mixture to some kind of container with a spout for easy pouring.

Evenly fill the containers with yogurt mixture. If you are using the 8 oz mason jars then fill each one with 6 ounces of the yogurt mixture. Should there be any bubbles on the top of the yogurt, use a spoon to scoop them out to give them a smooth surface.
Fill a tea kettle with water and bring to a near boil. Before the water should come to a boil, turn off the heat.
Pour the hot water into the baking tray and fill it up half way.
Transfer the baking tray to the oven but it is VERY IMPORTANT to double check that the oven is turned off.
Do not put the lids on the jars yet. Just lay some paper towels over the jars.
Then place a cookie sheet or baking tray on top of the paper towels.
The yogurt needs to incubate for 8 hours. Leave the yogurt in the oven with the door closed. It is not necessary to turn on the oven light.
After 8 hours, check to see if the yogurt is done by tilting the jar. It should now be solid and there should not be any liquid dripping from it. Remove from the oven and place the lids on the jars.
Transfer the yogurt to the refrigerator to chill for 4 hours.
The following are brands that were used in this recipe:
Notes: It is best to make a batch of yogurt in the morning so that you can enjoy it by the end of the day.

name: Wonton Soup
summary: Wonton Soup – Canh Hoành Thánh is a comforting and flavorful dish made with a rich pork bone broth and homemade wontons filled with seasoned ground pork and minced shrimp. The soup is enhanced with aromatics like onion and chicken soup base, then garnished with herbs, fried shallots, and black pepper. Enjoy it on its own or with a spicy dipping sauce for an extra kick.
ingredients: 1 Tablespoon Totole Chicken Soup Base Mix
OR Cut Chinese Chives, Fried Shallots & Black Pepper
steps: Fill a large soup pot with water. Add in the pork bones and bring the water to a boil.
Boil for 5 minutes. Slightly reduce the heat to prevent the water from boiling over. Skim off impurities.
Rinse the bones clean and set aside.
Make the broth. Fill a large soup pot with 10 cups of water. Add in 1 tablespoon of salt.
Add in 3 of the Condensed Wonton Seasoning cubes.
And lastly add in 1 tablespoon of Totole Chicken Soup Base Mix and bring to a boil.
Place the pork bones in the pot.
Peel a whole yellow onion. Slice the top and bottom of the onion in a criss cross fashion but not all the way through. Also place the onion in the pot.
Bring back to a boil. Then reduce the heat to Medium-Low and simmer for 1 hour.
Check back often to remove any foam from the top of the broth.
After an hour of simmering, discard the yellow onion and remove the pork bones from the broth.

Save the pork bones. You can tear off the meat and dip them into some Vietnamese Fish Sauce Dipping Sauce ( Nuoc Mam Cham ) or you can even add them to the wonton soup if you'd like. It would be a shame to let them go to waste.
Make the filling. In a bowl combine the ground pork with the minced shrimp.
Also add in the sugar, garlic salt, black pepper, fish sauce, Maggi Seasoning, sesame oil, chopped shallot and chopped green onions.
Wrap the wontons. Lay a wonton wrapper on a plate. Then add 1 teaspoon of the filling in the center of the wonton wrapper. Wet all four edges of the wonton wrapper.
Place the rest of the unused wonton wrappers in a zip loc bag to prevent them from drying out. Or you can place a damp towel over the stack of wonton wrappers.
Fold the bottom up and gently press down along the edges to seal it.
Fold the top down over the filling.
Dap some water onto the right corner of the wonton wrapper. Gently push at the center of the wonton and this will bring the two corners closer together.
Then place the left corner over the right corner so that it overlaps one another. Press down to seal them together.
Place on a plate and set aside.
Boil the wontons. Fill a large pot halfway up with water and bring to a boil.
Drop in the wontons and bring back to a boil. I like to add in only 10 at a time so that they have some room to float around.
Wait for all the wontons to float to the top .
Then add in 2 cups of cold water to pot. This step is to ensure that the wontons get fully cooked through.
As soon as it has come back to a boil immediately remove the wontons from the pot.
Place the wontons in a bowl.
Ladle some of the broth over the wontons. Garnish with some chopped green onions, chopped cilantro, a handful of fried shallots and a sprinkle of black pepper.
Or if you choose to you can garnish with some chinese chives, a handful of fried shallots and a sprinkle of black pepper.
Serve with a spicy dipping sauce (optional) .
In a small bowl combine 1 tablespoon of Hoisin Sauce, 1/2 teaspoon of Siracha and 1/2 teaspoon of Sa-te sauce.
Here are some of the brands that was used in this recipe and some notes:
With one pound of ground pork I was able to make 74 wontons. If you do not want to make all of it in one day you can freeze the half of the filling and save it for another day.
In my family we had served each person 10 wontons and there was enough soup for 7 people.

name: Yu Choy Soup
summary: Yu Choy Soup (Canh Cải Ngọt) is a light and comforting Vietnamese vegetable soup made with tender yu choy greens and seasoned ground pork. The pork is marinated with fish sauce, garlic salt, and aromatics, then simmered in a savory broth infused with dried shrimp and chicken flavoring. This simple yet flavorful soup pairs perfectly with rice and makes a nourishing addition to any meal.
ingredients: 1/2 Teaspoon Totole Chicken Flavor Soup Base Mix
2 Tablespoons Totole Chicken Flavor Soup Base Mix
steps: In a bowl combine the ground pork with the fish sauce, garlic salt, black pepper, sugar, chicken flavor soup base mix and chopped shallots. Mix well and set aside.
Then separate the ground pork into smaller pieces and place on a plate.
Wash and trim the ends of the Yu Choy.
Cut into 2'' lengths. Separate the stems from the leaves and any stems that are too thick can be cut in half lengthwise. Set aside.
On Medium High heat bring a pot of water to boil and add in the salt.
And add in the chicken flavor soup base mix.
And then add the the black pepper.
Once the water has come to a boil add in the ground pork.
Skim the foam from the top of the soup.
After adding in the ground pork let the soup come back to a boil again and then add in the stems of the Yu Choy. Cook the stems for 3 minutes and the soup should just about come back to a boil again.
This time add in the leaves of the Yu Choy and press them down into the soup.
Cook for 1 minute and gently turn the Yu Choy over .
Notes: Cook the soup on Medium High heat the entire time.

name: Chocolate Chia Pudding
summary: Chocolate Chia Pudding is a nutritious and easy-to-make treat that’s perfect for a healthy snack or breakfast. Made with unsweetened vanilla almond milk, cacao powder, maple syrup, and raw chia seeds, this recipe delivers a rich chocolate flavor while staying dairy-free and naturally sweetened. Coconut flakes add texture, while optional pumpkin seeds and sunflower kernels bring a satisfying crunch.
ingredients: 1 1/4 Cup Silk Unsweetened Vanilla Almond Milk
steps: Pour the Unsweetened Vanilla Almond Milk into a wide mouth 500 ml mason jar or seal-able container.
Also add in the ground cinnamon.
Then add in the chia seeds.
Add in the unsweetened coconut flakes.
Lastly add in the pumpkin seeds and sunflower kernels. (Optional )
Screw the lid onto the mason jar and shake it well.

Refrigerate overnight. Give the jar a shake before going to bed and again the next morning. It is best to let the chocolate pudding sit in the refrigerator for at least 24 hours to allow the chia seeds to expand and thicken the pudding.
Shake the jar once more before serving.
( Optional ) Top with more coconut flakes, pumpkin seeds and sunflower kernels if desired.
Below are some of the brands used in this recipe:
If you would like your Chocolate Chia Pudding to be sweeter just add more of the maple syrup.

name: Egg And Avocado Toast
summary: This Egg and Avocado Toast is a wholesome and satisfying breakfast that combines creamy avocado, lightly sautéed spinach, and over-easy eggs on toasted multigrain bread. Topped with a smear of low-fat cream cheese, fresh cherry tomatoes, and a sprinkle of salt and black pepper, it’s a nutritious and energizing way to start your day.
steps: Lightly toast the 2 slices of bread.
In the meantime cook the eggs. In a skillet on Medium-High heat add in 1/2 a tablespoon of Olive Oil. Once the oil is hot, crack in 2 eggs and immediately reduce the heat to Medium.
Cover and cook the eggs for about 3 minutes.
Then flip the eggs over, cover with a lid and continue to cook for about 15 to 20 seconds.
Slide the eggs onto a plate and set aside.
Spread a thin layer of the cream cheese onto the toasted bread.
Top with a handful of spinach leaves.
Lay 3 slices of avocado onto the spinach leaves.
Slide the cooked egg over the avocado slices.
Season the egg with salt and black pepper to taste.
Place a few of the cherry tomato halves over the egg. Repeat the toppings for the second slice of toast. Serve open faced and enjoy !
Below are some of the ingredients used in this recipe:

name: Greek Yogurt Parfait
summary: The Greek Yogurt Parfait is a refreshing and nutritious breakfast or snack option layered with non-fat Greek yogurt, fresh strawberries, blueberries, diced peaches, and a crunchy honey, almond, and chia granola blend. It’s a quick and easy recipe that's both satisfying and packed with protein, fiber, and natural sweetness.
ingredients: 1 Package Diced Peaches (No Sugar Added, Drained)
1 Package Granola (Honey, Almond & Chia Granola Blend)
steps: Start by adding a spoonful or two of the greek yogurt to the bottom of the cup.
Then add in the drained peaches.
Add another layer of the greek yogurt.
Then add a spoonful or two of the granola blend.
Add another layer of the greek yogurt.
Add the final layer of the yogurt.
Top with a bit more of the blueberries and diced peaches along with some granola.

name: Healthy Turkey Avocado Sandwich
summary: The Healthy Turkey Avocado Sandwich is a light and satisfying meal made with organic whole grain bread, lean oven-roasted turkey, creamy avocado slices, fresh lettuce, and juicy tomatoes. A touch of light mayo and optional mustard adds flavor without overpowering the wholesome ingredients. It's perfect for a nutritious lunch or quick dinner.
ingredients: 2 Slices Dave's Killer Bread (Thin-Sliced Organic Good Seed Bread)
1–2 Romaine or Boston Leaf Lettuce Leaves (or a Handful of Spring Mix Lettuce)
steps: Spread some light mayonaise onto one or both slices of bread.
Next squeeze on a little bit of mustard if desired.
Top with lettuce of your choice either Boston, Romaine or Spring Mix.
Then add some thinly sliced avocados.
Lay a slice of Low Fat Swiss Cheese over the avocados.
And lastly add 3-5 slices of the Oven Roasted Turkey.
Place the other slice of bread over the top!
And enjoy your turkey avocado sandwich!
Below are some of the brands used in this recipe and some notes:
For this type of bread I prefer it not to be toasted but that's just my preference. You can slightly toast it if you'd like your bread to be a bit on the stiffer side.

name: Light Avocado Egg Salad
summary: This Light Avocado Egg Salad is a nutritious and satisfying open-faced sandwich perfect for a quick lunch or snack. Made with a creamy blend of mashed avocado, chopped egg, fresh tomatoes, and onions, it's layered on a hearty slice of Dave’s Killer Bread and topped with extra egg, tomatoes, and a sprinkle of salt and pepper for added flavor and texture.
ingredients: 1 Tablespoon Chopped Red Onions (Use 1/2 Tablespoon if preferred)
1 Large Slice Dave's Killer Bread (Good Seed Bread)
steps: Cook the eggs. If you need directions on how to cook 'Perfect Hard Boiled Eggs' please visit my website at www.EatWithEmily.com .
Chop the cherry tomatoes, red onion and green onions.
Mash the avocado and combine with the chopped cherry tomatoes, chopped red onions, chopped green onions, chopped eggs and light mayonaise. Gently mix to combine.
Spread onto one slice of Dave's Killer Bread ( Good Seed Bread ).
Top with more of the chopped cherry tomatoes and chopped hard boiled eggs. Sprinkle on some salt and black pepper to taste. Serve the sandwich open faced.

name: Leftover Rotisserie Chicken
summary: This healthy and flexible recipe makes the most of leftover rotisserie chicken by turning it into two quick and delicious meal options. For a light sandwich, layer the chicken with fresh spinach and a touch of light mayo between slices of Dave’s Killer Bread. Or, toss the chicken with quinoa and brown rice, add spinach, and spice it up with sriracha or chili garlic paste for a simple, satisfying rice dish.
ingredients: Maggi Seasoning (or your favorite soy sauce)
2 Slices Dave's Killer Bread (Organic Good Seed's Bread, Untoasted)
For the rotisserie chicken rice dish
1 Package Quinoa & Brown Rice with Garlic (8.5 oz)
steps: Saute the leftover rotisserie chicken in a little bit of olive oil over medium-high heat. Add a splash of soy sauce and saute the chicken for about 2-3 minutes. Remove from the pan and let cool.
Spread some light mayonaise onto the bread.
Add a handful of fresh spinach.
Place the other slice of bread on top and eat!
For the Rotisserie Chicken Rice Dish: Heat the brown rice according to the directions on the back of the package.

Once the rice has been heated immediately add in a handful of spinach and toss to slightly cook the spinach. Then top with the rotisserie chicken. Add some Siracha or Chili Garlic Paste for some heat if desired.

name: Overnight Oatmeal
summary: Start your day right with this healthy and customizable Overnight Oatmeal. Made with quick oats, chia seeds, and vanilla almond milk, it's a nutritious and effortless breakfast that soaks overnight for perfect texture. Top it with your favorite fruits, nuts, and a drizzle of maple syrup for added flavor and crunch.
ingredients: 1 Cup Vanilla Almond Milk (For less sugar, use Unsweetened Almond Milk or Low Fat Milk)
steps: Pour the Quick Oats into a container of your choice.
Then add in the raw chia seeds.
Also add in a pinch of salt and pour in the vanilla almond milk. Stir to combine.

Top with some fresh fruits. (Optional) Only add the fresh fruits the night before if you plan to eat your oatmeal cold the following morning. If you are going to re-heat your oatmeal the next morning then do not add the fresh fruits until AFTER the oatmeal has been microwaved.
Drizzle some maple syrup over the bananas or oatmeal if you'd like. ( This is optional. )
Serve hot or cold. If you prefer hot oatmeal then microwave it for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes.

For less calories and less sugar use UNsweetened Almond milk  or Low Fat milk instead of the Vanilla Almond Milk. You can add up to 1 Teaspoon of Chia Seeds if you'd like in this recipe. You can use a short wide mouthed mason jar or a plastic container to store the oatmeal.

If using fresh fruits you can add them in the night before only  if you are going to eat it cold. If you are going to eat the oat meal hot then add the fresh fruits after the oatmeal has been microwaved the next morning.

f you are a Costco shopper, than you can purchase the Unsweetened Vanilla Almond Milk , the Organic Maple Syrup and the bananas at Costco. Please check with your local Costco for product availability as not all Costcos carry the same products.

name: Perfect Hard Boiled Eggs
summary: Learn how to make Perfect Hard Boiled Eggs every time with this simple method. Easy to peel and perfectly cooked—ideal for snacks, salads, or meal prep.
steps: In a saucepan place the eggs in a single layer. Then fill it with enough cold water to cover the eggs.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Once it has come to a boil immediately turn off the heat.
Cover the saucepan with a lid and let the eggs sit in the pan for 12 minutes.
Drain the eggs then place under cold running water until slightly cooled.
Then transfer the eggs to a bowl of cold water until completely cooled.
Gently crack and peel the eggs. Start peeling at the very bottom of the eggs at the air pocket and peel under cool running water.
Now you will have some perfectly cooked eggs! The yolks will be smooth and creamy with no green edges!

name: Kale Spinach Berry Smoothie Recipe
summary: This refreshing smoothie blends unsweetened vanilla almond milk, honey, frozen banana, and a vibrant mix of berries and greens from the Fresh Start Smoothie Blend. It's a quick, nutrient-packed drink perfect for a healthy breakfast or energizing snack.
ingredients: 1/2 Cup Fresh Start Smoothie Blend (Blueberries, Strawberries, Raspberries, Kale, and Spinach)
steps: Slice half of a banana, place in a zip loc bag and freeze overnight.
Pour 1 1/4 cups of the unsweetened vanilla almond milk into a personal size blender. Next add 1 tablespoon of honey, the frozen banana slices and 1/2 a cup of the frozen Fresh Start Smoothie Blend.

Check the consistency of the smoothie. If it is too thick then simply add more of the unsweetened vanilla almond milk. If it is not thick enough, you can add some ice cubes. If you prefer it sweeter, simply add more honey.

The bag of Fresh Start Smoothie Blend was purchased at Costco and it contains a mixture of frozen blueberries, strawberries, raspberries, kale and spinach. Just be sure that each time you add the frozen blend to the blender that there are strawberries in each scoop otherwise without the strawberries it will slightly change the taste of your smoothie. It definitely tastes better with the strawberries in it!

name: Mixed Berry Smoothie
summary: Healthy Mixed Berry Smoothie is a refreshing and nutritious drink made with unsweetened vanilla almond milk, honey, vanilla extract, frozen banana, and a blend of mixed berries. This smoothie is perfect for a quick breakfast or a post-workout snack, offering a naturally sweet flavor and a boost of antioxidants and fiber.
steps: Slice half of a banana and freeze overnight.
Pour the unsweetened vanilla almond milk into a personal size blender. Next add the honey, vanilla extract , frozen banana slices and frozen berries.
