This dish uses Korean beef short ribs seared in oil and seasoned with garlic salt and crushed red pepper. They're then simmered in a rich Korean BBQ sauce with minced garlic, allowing the flavors to soak in. Perfect for a satisfying dinner, these ribs are best served with steamed rice and your favorite Korean side dishes.
ingredients: 1 Jar Korean BBQ Sauce (17.64 fl oz, Chicken & Pork Marinade)
steps: Place the ribs in a large bowl and sprinkle on the garlic salt and crushed red pepper. Then mix.
Pour in half of the Korean BBQ sauce or enough to completely coat the ribs.
Throw in the minced garlic and mix.
Brush some cooking oil onto a grill pan and turn the heat on to Medium High.
Once the oil is hot add the beef ribs and cook until browned.
Flip the beef ribs over and reduce the heat to Medium. Then cook the beef until browned.
Serve with white rice and Kimchi.

name: Cast Iron Skillet Lamb Chops
summary: This Cast Iron Skillet Lamb Chops recipe features a flavorful lamb rib roast seared to perfection. The lamb is brushed with olive oil, seasoned with Montreal Steak Seasoning, and pan-cooked in a cast iron skillet with butter and oil for a rich, savory crust. Serve it hot with A.1. Original Steak Sauce for an elevated dining experience.
ingredients: 2 Pounds Lamb Rib Roast (Rack) (slice between the ribs and divide into 2 groups)
1/3 Cup Extra Virgin Olive Oil (brush onto the lamb chops)
1 1/2 Tablespoons McCormick Grill Mates Montreal Steak Seasoning
steps: Remove the lamb from the refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking and to allow it to come to room temperature.
Pat dry the rack of ribs with some paper towels.
Slice between each rib to separate the chops.
Brush some olive oil onto both sides of the chops.
Sprinkle on some of the Montreal Steak seasoning to both sides of the lamb chops.
Then stand the lamb chops up and dip the fatty side of the chops onto the seasonings.
Separate the lamb chops into 2 groups.The lamb chops should be cooked in two batches as to not over crowd the pan. Tie 4 lamb chops together with a cooking twine.
Do the same with the leftover four lamb chops.
Heat a 12” cast iron skillet over Medium-High heat and once the pan is hot, drizzle in 2 tablespoons of olive oil and 3 tablespoons of butter. Immediately reduce the heat to Medium.
Place the lamb chops in the skillet standing up with the fatty edge side down.
Cook for about 2-3 minutes until the fat turns slightly crispy and brown.
Then cut and remove the twine.
Sear the lamb chops. Lay the lamb chops down onto its side and let them cook undisturbed for 4 minutes until browned.
Turn the lamb chops over. Then use a spoon to baste the chops with the butter in the pan. Sear for 3 minutes.
Remove from the pan and let the chops rest for 5 minutes on the counter.
Serve with some A-1 steak sauce for dipping. (Optional)
Notes: If you'd like, you can toss in some crushed garlic cloves into the pan with the lamb chops.

name: Macaroni Salad
summary: This Macaroni Salad is a hearty and colorful side dish made with tender elbow macaroni and mixed vegetables like carrots, peas, corn, and green beans. It’s dressed in a creamy blend of mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, apple cider vinegar, and a touch of sugar for balance. Lightly seasoned and topped with a sprinkle of paprika, this chilled salad is perfect for potlucks, picnics, or as a refreshing side to grilled meats.
ingredients: 1 Package Frozen Mixed Vegetables (16 oz – includes carrots, peas, corn, and green beans)
1 Tablespoon + 1/2 Teaspoon Dijon Mustard with Chardonnay
steps: Fill a pot with some water and add 1 tablespoon of salt. Bring to a boil.
Once the water has come to a boil pour in the macaroni and cook for 9 minutes. Stir occasionally.
Drain and rinse with cold water to cool the noodles down. Be sure to toss the noodles a few times to remove any excess water. Then set aside for 30 minutes to allow the noodles to dry.
Remove the lima beans from the bag of vegetables and save for some other use or discard. If you like lima beans then you can just leave them in the mix.
Pour the frozen vegetables into a bowl and fill it with water. Microwave for 5 minutes to defrost the vegetables.
Drain and set aside for 30 minutes to allow the vegetables to dry.
In a bowl add in the mayonaise.
Then add in the apple cider vinegar. Stir to combine.
Also add in the dijon mustard with chardonnay. Stir to combine.
Add the sugar. Stir to dissolve the sugar.
And lastly add the black pepper. Combine well. Place in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to chill.
Once the noodles have dried, pour the cooked macaroni into a large mixing bowl.
Add in only 1 to 1 1//3 cup of the dressing and reserve the rest for later. Do not add all of it in at this time. Toss to coat the macaroni with the dressing.
Next add in the vegetables and toss to combine.
Season with salt and black pepper. (Optional)
Cover and chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.

The macaroni salad will dry up a bit in the refrigerator so right before serving, pour the remainder of the dressing onto the salad. If there is not enough dressing, you can always make another batch and add it to the bowl of macaroni.

name: McDonald’s Egg McMuffin Sandwich
summary: This homemade McDonald’s Egg McMuffin Sandwich recipe shows you how to recreate the fast food classic in your own kitchen. It features a toasted English muffin layered with Canadian bacon, a perfectly shaped fried egg, and a slice of melted American cheese. With a few simple tools like a ring mold and a small frying pan, you can enjoy this iconic breakfast sandwich fresh and hot right at home.
ingredients: 7 1/2" Fry Pan with Lid (small fry pan)
Ring Mold or a Wide Mouth Mason Jar Lid Ring
steps: Melt the butter in the microwave. Set aside.
Split the muffin in half and lightly toast the muffins in a bread toaster.
Remove the toasted muffins from the toaster and brush some of the melted butter onto both halves of the muffins.
Then place a slice of cheese onto the bottom muffin and set aside.

Lay a ring mold in the center of the pan and spray the ring mold and pan with the cooking spray. If using a mason jar lid turn it upside down then coat with the cooking spray. Then turn your heat on to Medium.
Once the pan is warm, crack in the egg and then break the yolk.
Cover the pan with a lid.

Cook for about 2 minutes or until the egg is set. Most or all of the water should have evaporated. Turn off the heat. Use a knife to go around the edge of the ring mold to loosen the egg from the ring mold. Season with a sprinkle of salt and black pepper.
Use a tong to pick up the ring mold and flip the egg over. Remove the ring mold from the pan.
Place the egg on top of the slice of toasted muffin with cheese. Set aside.
Wipe the pan clean. Then brush some melted butter onto the pan and turn your heat on to Medium-Low. Place the canadian bacon in the pan.
Cook both sides of the canadian bacon until slightly browned.
Place the cooked canadian bacon on top of the cooked egg.
Lastly place the other half of the english muffin on top of the canadian bacon.

name: Massaged Kale Salad
summary: This Massaged Kale Salad is a refreshing and nutrient-packed dish made with chopped kale massaged in tangy balsamic vinaigrette. It’s sweetened naturally with mandarin oranges and dried cranberries, then topped with crunchy honey roasted sliced almonds for texture. A simple yet flavorful salad perfect as a side or light meal.
ingredients: 1 Bottle of Newman’s Own Balsamic Vinaigrette Dressing (16 oz)
1 Package of Dole Mandarin Orange Cups in 100% Fruit Juice (drained)
A handful of Honey Roasted Sliced Almonds
steps: Drain the juice from 1 of the mandarin orange cups and set the mandarins aside.
Pour the chopped kale into a large mixing bowl.
Discard any stems as they are hard to chew.
Add a splash ( 2-3 tablespoons) of Balsamic Vinaigrette dressing. Adding in a little bit of the dressing will help wilt the kale.
Massage the kale with your hands by grabbing a bunch and squeezing them for about 2-3 minutes or until they have softened. They will shrink down in size.
Then add in a handful of dried cranberries and massage the salad for about a minute until the dried cranberries are slightly softened.
Pour in a little bit more of the Balsamic Vinaigrette dressing just enough to coat the entire salad.
Then add in a handful of the Dole mandarin oranges and a handful of the honey roasted sliced almonds.
Use a pair of tongs to toss the salad.
Notes: This recipe is meant to serve as a side salad. In this recipe 8 ounces of kale is enough for 4 people as a SIDE dish. Just figure 2 ounces of kale per person.

name: Mexican Salad
summary: Mexican Salad is a quick and flavorful dish made with crisp iceberg lettuce, shredded Mexican blend cheese, pico de gallo, chopped cilantro, tri-color tortilla strips, sour cream, and creamy avocado. It’s topped off with a drizzle of ranch dressing and a splash of hot sauce for a refreshing yet zesty meal or side.
ingredients: 1 Package of Fresh Express Shreds Iceberg Lettuce (8 oz)
A handful or two of Shredded Mexican Blend Cheese
steps: Pour the entire package of shredded lettuce into a large bowl.
Add a handful or two of the blended Mexican shredded cheese to the salad and 1/2 a cup of pico de gallo.
Also add in a handful of chopped cilantro and 1/2 a cup of the tri-color tortilla chips.
Lastly add a dollop of sour cream and some chopped avocadoes.
Serve with Ranch dressing or hot sauce.

name: Oven Baked Lobster Tails
summary: Oven Baked Lobster Tails are tender and flavorful lobster tails baked to perfection with a simple seasoning of salt, melted butter, and paprika or seafood seasoning. Served with fresh lemon and extra melted butter for dipping, this dish offers a delicious, elegant seafood experience that’s easy to prepare at home.
steps: Place a large bowl in the sink and fill it with some cold water. Then add a round of salt. Wash the lobster tails in the salted water. Then give the lobster tails a quick rinse.
Use a kitchen knife to cut a slit right down the center of the back of the lobster tail. Use your hands to pull the lobster meat through the slit to have the lobster meat lay on top of the shell.
Once the meat is laying on top of the shell use a knife to cut a slit down the center of the lobster meat.

Place the lobster tails on a plate and brush the melted butter over the lobster meat. Then sprinkle on some paprika or seafood seasoning. If you are going to use seafood seasoning then only give it a light sprinkle as it can be a bit salty.
Spray the lobster meat with the cooking olive oil spray.
Line a baking tray with aluminum foil. Spray the lined baking tray with the cooking spray. Then place the lobster tails on the baking tray and transfer the tray to the pre-heated oven.

Check on the lobster tails after baking them for 20 minutes. Remove the lobster tails from the oven once they are no longer opaque. If they are still opaque continue baking them for another 10 to 15 minutes.
Serve with a side of fresh squeezed yellow lemon juice and some melted butter for dipping. Yellow lemons are not always available so in that case they can be replaced with limes.

name: Pasta Primavera
summary: Pasta Primavera is a hearty and colorful baked pasta dish loaded with sautéed vegetables and topped with melty mozzarella cheese. Penne pasta is cooked and tossed with a rich, homemade Alfredo sauce, then combined with mushrooms, onions, tomatoes, and spinach for a vibrant, satisfying meal. Perfect for a vegetarian main or a crowd-pleasing side.
ingredients: For adding to the baking pan:
16 Oz Block of Mozzarella Cheese (grated – mix 1 cup into the pasta and top with the remaining cheese)
steps: Cook the noodles. Bring a pot of water to boil. Then add 1 tablespoon of salt. Pour in the pasta and cook until al dente.
Drain the pasta. There is no need to rinse the pasta.
Add 2 tablespoons of butter to a baking pan.
Then dump the cooked pasta into the pan. Mix to coat the pasta with the butter to prevent them from sticking to one another. Set aside.
Make the alfredo sauce. On medium heat, melt the butter then toss in the garlic. Cook the garlic until fragrant.
Reduce the heat to LOW then add the flour to the pan. Whisk until the two ingredients are combined. They should start to form lumps
Gradually pour in the half & half and whisk continuously. Add just a little bit of milk at first about 1/2 a cup. Continuously whisk until there are no more lumps and the flour mixture is smooth.
Add in the grated parmesan cheese and stir.
Add in 1 teaspoon of garlic salt.
Add in 1/8 teaspoon of black pepper and stir.
Bring the sauce to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer until the sauce has thickened. Stirring occasionally.
The whole process of making the alfredo sauce should take about 10 minutes. Then set the sauce aside.

Saute the veggies. Heat up a cast iron skillet on MEDIUM HIGH heat. Once the pan is hot, add in the olive oil and wait 15 seconds for the oil to warm up. Then add in the mushrooms, garlic and onions. Give it a quick stir . If the bottom of the pan is dry, you can add another 1 tablespoon of olive oil to the pan.
Then leave the mushrooms, garlic and onions alone in the pan until it has browned on one side. When the bottom of the veggies are slightly browned, give them a toss.
Then add in the cherry tomatoes. Toss and cook until slightly soft. Season with 1/4 teaspoon of salt and 1/8 teaspoon of black pepper.
Turn off the heat and add in the spinach. Toss until the spinach is slightly wilted.
Then transfer to a baking tray to cool.

Time to put it all together ! Warm up the alfredo sauce in the microwave for 30 seconds to a minute . Pour the alfredo sauce over the pasta and use a large spoon to mix. You may not need to use all of the alfredo sauce. It will depend on how saucy you like your pasta to be. In the video I had about 1 cup of alfredo sauce remaining.
Add 1 cup of the shredded mozarella cheese and mix.
Add the cooked vegetables. Scoop out the vegetables only and be sure to leave any liquid on the bottom of the pan behind. Discard the liquid. Gently mix the pasta and vegetables with your hands.
Season with ¼ of teaspoon of salt and ⅛ teaspoon of black pepper. Mix for the last time.
Completely cover the pasta with the remaining MOZARELLA cheese.
Roast in the oven at 450 degrees until the cheese is browned.
Note: Please note that if you are going to bake the pasta in the 8'' aluminium pans then there is enough pasta to fill 3 of them.

name: Perfect Hard Boiled Eggs
summary: Perfect Hard Boiled Eggs are easy to make and ideal for meal prep, salads, or snacks. This simple method ensures tender whites and creamy yolks every time—just add eggs to cold water, bring to a boil, then let them sit covered off the heat. A kitchen basic done right.
steps: In a saucepan place the eggs in a single layer. Then fill it with enough cold water to cover the eggs.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Once it has come to a boil immediately turn off the heat.
Cover the saucepan with a lid and let the eggs sit in the pan for 12 minutes.
Drain the eggs then place under cold running water until slightly cooled.
Then transfer the eggs to a bowl of cold water until completely cooled.
Gently crack and peel the eggs. Start peeling at the very bottom of the eggs at the air pocket and peel under cool running water.
Now you will have some perfectly cooked eggs! The yolks will be smooth and creamy with no green edges!

name: Portebella Pizza
summary: Portebella Pizza is a delicious low-carb alternative to traditional pizza, using large portabella mushroom caps as the base. The mushrooms are brushed with olive oil, then topped with pizza sauce, shredded mozzarella cheese, pepperoni, and fresh basil. Baked until the cheese is melted and bubbly, this quick and savory dish is perfect for a healthy meal or appetizer.
ingredients: 3 Tablespoons Olive Oil (to coat the mushrooms)
8 oz Block of Mozzarella Cheese (shredded from the block)
steps: Pat the mushrooms dry with paper towels. Then remove the stem and gills.
Brush olive oil onto the top and bottom of the mushrooms.
Grate the block of mozarella cheese. Please do not use pre-shredded cheese as it sometimes does not melt as well. Set aside.
Now add spoon some pizza sauce onto each of the mushrooms.
Next add a handful of cheese. Do not add too much cheese onto the mushrooms as it can overflow when cooking in the oven.
Lastly top with the pepperoni slices.
Brush some olive oil onto the surface of the grill pan.

Transfer the mushrooms to a grill pan or baking dish. If using a baking dish the mushrooms will release some liquid as it cooks in the oven. After it is done cooking in the oven you may want to place the mushrooms on a plate lined with paper towels to soak up some of the liquid to dry the bottoms of the mushrooms.
Place the grill pan in the oven and cook for 20 minutes.
While the mushrooms are baking chop the fresh basil and set aside.
After the mushrooms have baked for 20 minutes, increase the heat to 500 degrees and cook for another 5 minutes.
If the top of the cheese has not browned then you can place the mushrooms under the broiler for 30 seconds to a minute until they have slightly browned. This step is optional.
Remove the mushrooms from the oven and top with the chopped basils.

name: Roasted Pumpkin Seeds
summary: Roasted Pumpkin Seeds are a crunchy and savory snack made by seasoning raw pumpkin seeds with melted butter, olive oil, seasoning salt, and garlic salt, then baking them until golden. This easy recipe is a great way to use seeds from a fresh pumpkin and makes a perfect fall treat.
ingredients: 1 Medium Pumpkin (yields approximately 1 Cup Raw Pumpkin Seeds)
steps: Cut the top off of a medium sized pumpkin.
Stick you hands inside the pumpkin to remove the seeds leaving behind the pulp.
Rinse the seeds in a bowl filled with water. Rub the seeds between your hands to remove any flesh.
Drain in a colander and give the seeds a few toss.
Pour the seeds onto a baking tray lined with paper towels. Take another sheet of paper towel to pat dry the seeds. After 2 hours change the paper towel on the baking tray as it will be wet.
Then leave the baking tray on the counter overnight for the seeds to dry.
The next day the seeds will be ready to be roasted.
Pour the pumpkin seeds into a bowl.
There will be a few seeds that may slightly be stuck to the paper towel. All you have to do is rub the paper towel together and they will fall right off.
Then melt 2 tablespoons of butter in the microwave for 30 seconds. Be sure to place a plastic lid or paper plate over the bowl to prevent the melted butter from splattering all inside your microwave.
Pour the melted butter into the bowl of seeds and stir to coat.
Then pour in 1 teaspoon of olive oil and stir.
Add in 1 teaspoon seasoning salt and 1/8 teaspoon garlic salt. Toss to combine.
Line a baking tray with some parchment paper. Pour the seeds onto the baking tray.
Place the tray in the oven on the top level.
Bake for 15 minutes then turn the seeds over.
Bake for another 15 minutes and you're done! Total cooking time is 30 minutes.
Take them out of the oven and let them cool on the tray for 10 minutes. They will be slightly crispier after they cooled.
It is best to consume them the same day because once they are stored in an air tight container they won't be as crispy afterwards.

name: Rotini Pasta Salad
summary: This Rotini Pasta Salad is a colorful and flavorful dish made with tri-color rotini pasta, fresh vegetables, and savory additions like diced ham and sliced olives. Tossed in a tangy Zesty Italian dressing and topped with grated Parmesan cheese, it's perfect as a refreshing side or a light main course.
ingredients: 1 Box Barilla Tri-color Rotini Pasta (12 oz)
1 Small Green Bell Pepper (equals 1/2 cup diced)
1/2 of a Small Red Onion (equals 1/3 cup diced)
1 Can Pineapple Chunks in 100% Natural Juices (8 oz – equals 1 cup, each chunk sliced in half lengthwise)
1 Handful of Cherry Tomatoes (equals 1 cup, each sliced in half lengthwise)
1 Can Sliced Black Olives (2.5 oz – equals 1/2 cup)
1 Thick Cut Ham Steak (6 oz, diced)
1 Bottle Kraft Zesty Italian Dressing (16 oz)
steps: Place the pasta in a large pot filled with water and add 1 tablespoon of salt. Boil for 11-12 minutes.
Transfer to a bowl of cold water for a minute to cool it down. Then drain.
Place the noodles in a large mixing bowl.
Toss in the diced green bell peppers and mix.
Then add in the chopped red onions and mix.
Also add in the sliced pineapples and mix.
Then the sliced cherry tomatoes and mix.
Add in the diced ham and mix.
Also add in the sliced pepperoncini and mix.

Pour in 2/3 Cup of the Zesty Italian Dressing and save the rest for later. Mix to coat the pasta. Once refrigerated the dressing will dry up so before serving the salad be sure to add more of the Italian dressing.
Lastly toss in the grated parmesan cheese and mix.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Before serving add more of the Italian dressing.

name: Sausage Skillet With Vegetables
summary: Sausage Skillet With Vegetables is a hearty and colorful one-pan dish featuring sautéed red potatoes, spicy sausage, and a medley of bell peppers, mushrooms, and onions. Seasoned with garlic salt, chili flakes, and black pepper, this savory skillet meal is both flavorful and satisfying—perfect for a quick and comforting dinner.
ingredients: 5 Red Potatoes (leave skin on and slice ¼ inch thick)
3 Farmer John’s Hot Louisiana Smoked Sausages (or 1 Polish sausage link – your choice, slice ½ inch thick)
1/2 of a Red Onion (or substitute with yellow onion, sliced)
steps: Slice the sausages 1/2 inch thick. Then set aside.
Chop the garlic. Then set aside.
Slice the red, yellow and green bell peppers. Then set aside.
Slice the mushrooms. Then set aside.
Wash the potatoes clean and wipe dry. Then slice 1/4 inch thick. I had used 5 potatoes in this recipe but feel free to use less if you'd like.

In a pan on Medium-High heat, add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and 1 tablespoon of butter. Once the butter has melted, add the potatoes into the pan in a single layer, cover the pan with a lid and fry for about 4 minutes or until browned.
Flip the potatoes over, cover the pan and reduce the heat to Medium. Fry for 4-5 minutes or until browned.
Transfer the fried potatoes to a plate lined with paper towels and set aside. Do not wipe the pan clean! There should still be some leftover oil in the pan.
In the same pan, turn the heat to Medium and add the sausages in a single layer. Cook 3-4 minutes until browned.
Then turn the sausages over and cook for another 3-4 minutes until browned.
Transfer to a paper plate lined with paper towels and set aside. Do not clean out the pan!
Again in the same pan, on Medium-High heat toss in the chopped garlic, sliced red onions and sliced mushrooms. Saute for about a minute.

Then add in the sliced red bell peppers, sliced yellow bell peppers, sliced green bell peppers, and saute for 5 minutes until slightly tender. If the pan is dry at this point, you can add a little bit more cooking oil.
Add in the fried potatoes and sausages. Give it a quick toss then add in the seasonings.
Season with the chili flakes ( optional ) , black pepper, seasoning salt and garlic salt. Give it a mix.
Then gently toss the potatoes and sausages for 2-3 minutes until they are warmed through and the bell peppers are as tender as you desire.
Note: You can use Polish sausage or Smoked Sausages for this recipe!

name: Sauteed Butter Corn With Parsley
summary: This easy and flavorful recipe for Sauteed Butter Corn With Parsley combines sweet corn with melted butter, fresh parsley, and simple seasonings. It's a quick side dish that brings out the natural sweetness of the corn and adds a fresh, herby touch, perfect for any meal.
steps: Wash and chop the parsley. Set aside.
Drain the cans of corn. Set aside.
In a saute pan on Medium heat melt the butter.
Add the corn kernels to the pan.
Season with salt and black pepper. Cook for 10 minutes stirring occasionally.
Add in the chopped fresh parsley and cook for another 3 minutes until the parsley is wilted.
Then turn off the heat and give it a last sprinkle of some black pepper.

In a pinch you can substitute the fresh parsley with some dried parsley. The dried parsley will work for this recipe but it won't be as flavorful. Just add a handful or two of the dried parsley to the sauteed corn.

name: Shrimp And Asparagus Fettuccine
summary: This Shrimp and Asparagus Fettuccine is a creamy and flavorful pasta dish that's perfect for seafood lovers. Tender fettuccine noodles are paired with crisp asparagus spears and succulent shrimp, all tossed in a rich garlic butter and parmesan cream sauce. A sprinkle of black pepper, chili flakes, and fresh parsley adds the perfect finishing touch. It’s a satisfying and elegant meal that’s surprisingly easy to make.
ingredients: 24 Pieces of Large Shrimp (peeled and deveined)
steps: Boil the pasta. Bring a pot of water to boil. Pour in a round of salt and add a tablespoon of Olive Oil. Once the water has come to a boil add in the pasta. Wait for the noodles to separate. In about 2 minutes it will begin to unravel and it should unravel on its own. Once half of the noodles have unraveled you can help it unravel by gently separating the noodles. It will take about 5-6 minutes for the noodles to completely separate. Turn off the heat and drain in a colander. Do not rinse the noodles. Just set it aside.

Blanch the asparagus spears. Wash the asparagus spears and cut off the bottom woody section of the asparagus spears. Then cut into 1'' inch sections. Bring a pot of water to boil and pour in a round of salt. Once the water has come to a boil add in the asparagus. Boil for about 3 minutes until they are tender. Place in an ice bath. Once the the aspargus has cooled, drain and transfer to a bowl. Set aside.

In a saute pan on Medium High heat melt the butter. Once the butter has melted add in the garlic and saute for 30 seconds. Add in the shrimp and cook the shrimp on one side for about 1 1/2 minutes to 2 minutes .Flip them over and add in the asparagus. Saute until the shrimp is fully cooked which should take about 2 minutes. Becareful not to over cook the shrimp as they will become rubbery. Then transfer to a plate and set aside.
In the same pan pour in the heavy cream. You do not need to clean out the pan.Then turn the heat to Medium.

Season the sauce with some black pepper and garlic salt. Continuosly stir the sauce. Once it has come to a simmer reduce the heat to Medium Low then gradually add in the grated Parmesan cheese. Add in a handful at a time and then stir afterwards. Allow the cheese to melt before adding in another handful of grated cheese. Repeat until all the cheese has been added to the pan. It will take about 10 to 12 minutes for the sauce to thicken. Once the sauce has thickend add in the chopped parsley and stir. Then return the cooked shrimp and asparagus to the pan. Mix well. If the sauce is too thick add more heavy cream to thin it out and cook for another minute or two.
Turn off the heat and dump the pasta into the pan with the sauce. Toss until well coated with the sauce.
Garnish with black pepper, red chili pepper flakes, grated parmesan cheese , and chopped fresh parsley.

name: Shrimp Ceviche
summary: Shrimp Ceviche is a bright and refreshing seafood dish made with shrimp soaked overnight in fresh lime juice. It's mixed with diced Roma tomatoes, red onion, jalapeño, avocado, and chopped cilantro, then seasoned with olive oil, sugar, salt, and pepper. A flavorful dressing of Clamato, ketchup, and Valentina hot sauce ties it all together. Serve chilled with tostadas and an extra splash of hot sauce for a zesty appetizer or light meal.
ingredients: 20 Pieces Large Frozen Shrimp (thawed, peeled, deveined, and chopped)
1/2 of a Red Onion (1/2 cup diced)
steps: Place the frozen shrimp in a bowl of cold water and let it sit until thawed.
Drain and place the shrimp in a non-reactive bowl or container.
Pour in 1 cup of fresh squeezed lime juice.
The next day, drain the shrimp and discard the lemon juice. Cut the shrimp into smaller pieces.
Place the shrimp in a large mixing bowl and add the juice from 2 limes. Then set aside.
Slice the jalapeno in half to remove the seeds and dice. Removing the seeds is optional.
Season the ceviche with 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
Also add in 1/2 teaspoon of salt.
Mix well to incorporate and set aside.
Make the dressing. Pour the clamato juice into a small bowl.
And lastly add in the Valentina hot sauce.
Pour the dressing over the ceviche.
Cover the ceviche and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Right before serving gently fold in the diced avocados.
Sprinkle on some black pepper and do not mix.
Serve on top of a tostada.
Drizzle some more of the Valentina hot sauce on top of the ceviche.

Notes: If you do not want to soak the shrimp in the lime juice overnight then you can soak it the same day the ceviche is made. It will take anywhere from 1 to 3 hours for the shrimp to cook in the lime juice. Just check on the shrimp every hour until it is no longer opaque. You will know when the shrimp is done once it has turned pink.

Here's another option: To save time, you can also use frozen pre-cooked shrimp. You will need 16 oz of the Large Frozen Cooked Shrimp and 1 whole lime. Place the frozen cooked shrimp in a bowl of cold water and let it sit until thawed. Then drain and chop the shrimp into smaller pieces. Place the shrimp in a bowl with the juice from 1 whole lime. Let the shrimp soak in the lime juice for 30 minutes. Drain and discard the lime juice. Then add the shrimp in with the rest of the other ingredients: cilantro, garlic, jalapeno, tomatoes and red onions. Continue with the steps in the recipe.

name: Shrimp Dumplings
summary: Shrimp Dumplings are a delicious homemade treat made with a special dumpling flour mix and a savory shrimp filling. The dough is prepared using hot water, oil, and salt, while the shrimp is seasoned with garlic, chicken seasoning, and sesame oil for rich flavor. These dumplings are steamed to perfection and best enjoyed with sweet soy sauce or a spicy kick of Sriracha.
ingredients: 1 Package of Steamed Shrimp Dumpling Flour Mix (12 oz)
1/2 Teaspoon Sesame Oil (just about half of a teaspoon)
Sweet Soy Sauce (recipe available on my website)
steps: Peel and devein the shrimp. Place the shrimp in a bowl and wash the shrimp with some cold water. Add a round of salt to the water. Swish the shrimp around in the water. Then rinse the salt off of the shrimp. Mince the shrimp.
Then in a bowl combine the shrimp with the sugar, salt, black pepper, chicken seasoning cornstarch, minced garlic and sesame oil. Stir in one direction. Cover and refrigerate for one hour.

Pour the Steamed Shrimp Dumpling Flour mix into a bowl. Then add in the vegetable oil, salt and boiling water. Stir to combine. Kneed the flour with your hands until it forms a dough. Continue kneeding the dough until it is smooth. Place a damp towel over the dough. Set is aside and let it rest for 15 minutes.

After the dough has rested place some All Purpose Flour onto your work area. Also rub your hands with some of the flour as well to prevent the dough from sticking to your hands. Tear apart some of the dough and use the palm of your hand to roll the dough into a cylinder shape about the length of your cutting board horizontally. After you have rolled up the dough it will shrink up a bit in length and that is okay. Keep the rest of the unused dough under the damp towel.
Get the dumpling press ready by brushing some vegetable oil onto the surface of it. Set it aside.
Cut the cylinder into 6 pieces. Take one piece of the cut dough and roll it into a ball. Flatten the ball of dough with a rolling pin. Then place the flattened dough onto the dumpling press.
Place a little bit of the shrimp filling into the center of the dumpling press. Then close the dumpling press. Do not close it too tightly otherwise the outer edges of the dumplings will be too thin.
While the dumpling press is closed remove the excess dough. Open the dumpling press and remove the dumpling.
When you are ready to steam the dumplings take a piece of parchment paper and make some small holes or slits on the bottom of the paper. Line the bottom of the steamer with the parchment paper.
Fill the bottom of the steamer with some water and bring to a boil. Once the water has come to a boil place the dumplings onto the parchment paper.
Cover the steamer with a lid and steam on Medium High heat for 8-10 minutes.
Remove from the steamer. Dip with Sweet Soy Sauce and Siracha.

Notes: You can add chinese garlic chives or bamboo shoots into the dumplings as well. Whenever I eat dumplings at the chinese restaurant I like to dip my dumplings into a bowl of soy sauce mixed with some satay, hot mustard and siracha.

name: Authentic Plain Spanish Rice
summary: This Authentic Plain Spanish Rice is a flavorful side dish made by sautéing jasmine rice in butter and garlic, then simmering it in tomato sauce and chicken stock seasoned with garlic salt, chili powder, cumin, and black pepper. It's an easy and aromatic dish perfect to pair with your favorite Mexican or Latin meals.
steps: Rinse the grains of rice several times until the water runs clear. Strain the rice.
In a deep skillet over medium heat, melt 5 tablespoons of butter.
Once the butter has melted, toss in the minced garlic and cook for 15 seconds.
Then dump the rice into the pan and mix with the butter and minced garlic. Stirring occasionally, cook the rice for 5 minutes until the rice turns translucent.
Then pour in 1 cup of tomato sauce and mix until all the rice is coated with the sauce.
Pour in 3 cups of organic chicken stock and stir.
Stir in ½ teaspoon garlic salt, 1 teaspoon chili powder, ½ teaspoon cumin, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper and bring to a boil.
Once it comes to a boil, immediately reduce the heat to MEDIUM-LOW. Give it one last stir and place a lid on the pan.

Cook the rice for 25 minutes or until the rice is dry. If you do not have a good non-stick pan then you may have to stir the rice every 5 minutes otherwise it will create a crust on the bottom of the rice. But if you do stir the rice be sure to do it quickly to avoid all the heat from escaping from the pan which will cause your rice to be undercooked. If you have a good non-stick pan then you can cook your rice and leave it undisturbed for 25 minutes.

After cooking the rice for 25 minutes, TURN OFF THE HEAT. Give the rice a stir and fluff it up. Then place the lid back on the pan for 5 minutes. Then remove the lid and stir the rice once again. This time place the lid back on the pan for 10 minutes Remove the lid and stir again..
Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Then serve it with anything that you want! 🙂

name: Spam Musubi With A Soy Sauce Glaze
summary: Spam Musubi With A Soy Sauce Glaze is a Hawaiian-inspired snack made by layering cooked sushi rice, furikake seasoning, and pan-fried Spam on a sheet of nori. The Spam is seared and glazed with a sweet soy sauce mixture, adding a savory, caramelized flavor. Assembled using a musubi maker, each piece is compact and perfect for snacking or as a portable meal.
ingredients: Cooked Sushi Rice or Short Grain Rice (recipe available at EatWithEmily.com)
2 Cans Spam 25% Less Sodium (evenly sliced thin)
1 Package Sushi Nori Sheets (10 sheets – 8 inches each)
3 Tablespoons Kikkoman Less Sodium Soy Sauce
steps: Cook the Sushi rice. If you will be using my Sushi rice recipe, please only add half of the Sushi Vinegar to the cooked rice to make the Spam Musubi. After the rice has cooked, allow it to cool to room temperature. Place a wet towel over the bowl of rice to prevent it from drying out. (If you do not want to flavor your Sushi rice, then you can just omit the Sushi Vinegar)

Slice the Spam. Cut the block of Spam once lengthwise right down the center. Then make another cut down the center of the already cut piece and repeat one more time until all the slices are an even thickness.

Cook the Spam. In a skillet over medium heat, add in a tablespoon of vegetable oil. Lay the sliced Spam in the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes until browned. Then flip the spam over and again cook until browned. Remove from the skillet and place on a plate with some paper towels to drain any oil. Allow to cool. Set aside.

Make the Soy Sauce Glaze. In an unheated sauce pan pour in 3 tablespoons of the Kikkoman Less Sodium Soy Sauce and add in 2 tablespoons of sugar. Turn the heat on the Medium and continuously stir until the sugar is dissolved. Once the sauce starts to bubble and the sauce has slightly thickened, immediately turn off the heat. Pour into a bowl to cool and set aside. The whole process is quick and only takes a few minutes. Be careful not to burn the sauce. Also, the sauce will thicken up a bit more as it cools.
Spoon some of the Soy Sauce Glaze onto ONE side of the Spam and set aside.
Cut the Nori sheets into thirds. Make the first cut at the 2 ½” mark and just cut about an inch through the Nori sheet. Do not cut all the way through the Nori sheet just yet!
The 2 ½” inch mark is where you will then fold the Nori sheets into thirds. Just fold it over and over again to create creases in the Nori sheet.
Unfold the Nori sheet then cut along the creases to create 3 separate sheets.
Then place one of the Nori sheets that you have already cut, onto a cutting board with the shiny side down. Place the Musubi mold frame right in the center of the Nori sheet.
Place the Spam with the Soy Sauce Glaze on it, into the mold.
Next, scoop out ⅓ cup of the Sushi rice and sprinkle on some of the Nori Komi Furikake Rice Seasoning. Give the top of the rice a light pat with a spoon so that the seasoning sticks to the rice.
Then dump the Sushi rice into the mold and spread out the rice.
Use the Musubi Maker press and push down to flatten the rice.
While holding the Musubi Maker press down, lift the mold.
You should be left with just the Musubi Maker press on top of the rice.
Fold up one side of the Nori.

Then add a little bit of the Soy Sauce Glaze on top of the Nori. This will act as your glue. In this photo, my son added a little bit too much of the Soy Sauce Glaze. Jut add a thin line of glaze across the top is fine. Don't get the glaze sauce too close to the sides of the Nori as it may spill over onto the rice part.
Fold over the other end of the Nori.
Gently press down the edge of the Nori to seal it.
If you are not going to eat the Musubis right away then you can wrap them in some Saran Wrap to prevent the rice from drying out.
Place the Musubi with the Spam side down in the center of the Saran wrap.
Fold up one side of the Saran Wrap.
Then fold over the other side.
Bring in one end of the Saran Wrap.
Flip the wrapped Musubi over with the Spam side up.
Repeat the process with the rest of the Spam.

name: Spinach And Bacon Quiche
summary: Spinach And Bacon Quiche is a savory baked dish that combines crispy bacon, sautéed spinach, onions, and a rich egg mixture in a flaky deep-dish pie crust. With shredded Colby Jack and Monterey Jack cheese and a splash of half & half, this hearty quiche is perfect for brunch or a comforting meal any time of day.
ingredients: 6 Slices Cooked Bacon (warmed in microwave for 25 seconds)
1 Deep Dish 9-inch Frozen Pie Crust (let thaw about 20 minutes)
4 oz Colby Jack & Monterey Jack Cheese (shredded)
steps: Cut the cooked bacon strips into smaller pieces. If using cold cooked bacon then microwave for 25 seconds to warm them up. Set aside.

In a pan add over medium heat, melt the butter then add in the chopped onions. Cook the onions until translucent. Add in the spinach and reduce the heat to medium low. Cook the spinach until a little more than halfway wilted. Then turn off the heat and continue to cook the spinach in the residual heat until they are all wilted. This prevents the spinach from becoming over cooked and mushy.
Once they are all wilted, transfer the spinach to a plate and let cool.
In the meantime, shred the cheese and set aside.
Place the pie crust on a baking tray covered with aluminum foil to prevent spillage.

Place the spinach on the bottom of the pie crust then add on the bacon. Save a handful of the bacon pieces to place on top of the quiche later. Also add a handful of the shredded cheese. We will add the rest of the cheese later.
Crack the eggs into a bowl, add in 1/4 teaspoon of salt & 1/8 teaspoon black pepper and whisk.
Then pour in the half & half and stir.
Pour the egg mixture over the spinach and bacon pieces. Then add the rest of the shredded cheese and top with the remaining bacon pieces.
Transfer to the oven and place on the second level. Bake for 40 minutes at 375 degrees.
Then turn the heat up to 425 for 10-15 minutes or until the top of the pie is golden brown.

name: Sushi Rice
summary: This Sushi Rice recipe begins with short grain rice simmered with water and optional dashi kombu for subtle umami flavor. Once cooked, the rice is seasoned with a simple homemade sushi vinegar made from rice vinegar, sugar, and salt. Perfectly balanced and slightly sticky, this rice is ideal for all your sushi creations.
ingredients: A Piece of Dashi Kombu (about the size of your palm – optional)
steps: Wash the rice. Pour the grains of rice into the rice cooker liner and fill with water. Swish and swirl the rice around to remove the excess starch. Drain the cloudy water and add in some fresh water. Repeat the process 5-6 times until the water is clear or at least less cloudy. Transfer the rice to a sieve and drain completely.
Then pour the rinsed rice back into the rice cooker liner and add in 3 cups of water.

This next step is optional and can be skipped . Tear a large sheet of Kombu into smaller pieces. Use a damp paper towel to clean the Kombu on both sides. Take a piece of Kombu and place it into the rice cooker.
Close the lid on the rice cooker and plug it in. Press down on the lever to cook the rice.

While the rice is cooking make the Sushi Vinegar. In a saucepan on Medium heat pour in the unseasoned rice vinegar, sugar and salt. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Do not allow the mixture to come to a boil. As soon as the sugar is dissolved remove from the heat . Set it aside and let it cool. Another option of doing this is heating the Sushi Vinegar mixture in the microwave. Either method will work just fine.

After 15 minutes the rice cooker indicator should switch over from 'rice cooking' to 'keep warm'. Let it sit undisturbed for another 5 minutes then open the lid on the rice cooker. Remove the Kombu and discard.
Dump the cooked rice into a large non-reactive shallow bowl. Do not use a metal bowl. It is best to use a wooden Japanese Hangiri but if you do not own one then a plastic or glass bowl will do.
Remove any burnt crust on the bottom of the rice. Save for later use or discard.

While the rice is hot gradually drizzle the Sushi vinegar mixture evenly over the rice. Slice the rice at an angle and gently fold it over. Becareful not to mash the rice. Do not stir or mix it. While cutting into the rice you should be fanning it at the same time to cool it down. Do this for about 5 minutes. You can stop fanning once most of the liquid has been absorbed by the rice. Then let it cool to body temperature. Place on the counter and cover the bowl with a damp towel to prevent the rice from drying out. Do not refrigerate as it will harden the rice.

Allow the rice to absorb all of the vinegar mix. Let it sit on the counter for 45 minutes before you use it. Every so often come back to the rice, slice it at an angle and fold it over to fluff it up.

name: Sweet Cornbread – Cast Iron Skillet
summary: Sweet, buttery, and baked to golden perfection in a cast iron skillet, this Sweet Cornbread is the ultimate comfort side dish. Made with yellow cornmeal, sugar, and honey, then finished with a slather of warm honey or a pat of European-style butter, it's the perfect pairing for chili, BBQ, or any hearty meal.
ingredients: 1/4 Cup Butter (or 4 tablespoons of butter – melted)
1/2 Tablespoon Butter (to coat the hot skillet)
1 to 2 Tablespoons Honey (to slather on top of the hot cornbread)
steps: Pre-heat the oven at 375 degrees. Coat a cast iron skillet with some vegetable oil and place the skillet in the oven.
Next combine all the dry ingredients. Into a large mixing bowl first add in the all purpose flour.
Then add in the yellow cornmeal.
And also add in the sugar.
Add in the baking powder as well.
Stir to combine all the dry ingredients.
Next melt 4 tablespoons of butter in the microwave for 1 minute. Be sure to cover the bowl with a plate to prevent the butter from splattering everywhere.
Warm the milk in the microwave for 45 seconds. Then pour the milk into a small mixing bowl.
Also pour in the melted butter.
And lastly crack in the egg. Stir to combine the wet ingredients.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients.
Stir to combine the wet and dry ingredients.
Remove the hot skillet from the oven and add in 1/2 a tablespoon of butter.
Coat the bottom and the sides of skillet with the butter.
Then pour the batter into the hot skillet.
Place the skillet back into the pre-heated oven and bake for 25-30 minutes.
Check the cornbread for doneness at the 25 minute mark. Gently press in the center of the cornbread and if it springs back then it is done.

Remove the cornbread from the oven and let it sit on the counter for 10 minutes. Then evenly spread about 1-2 tablespoons of honey over the surface of the cornbread. It should just be a thin layer of honey. Do not over do it with the honey as it may make your cornbread too sweet. Then let sit for 2-3 minutes to allow the honey to dry up a bit and soak into the cornbread before serving.
Cut the cornbread into wedges. Use a rubber spatula to remove the cornbread from the pan.
Plate the cornbread and top with a slab of European Style butter.
If you would like to serve this as a dessert you can dust your cornbread with some powdered sugar.
Or if you would like to have this as a snack just add a glass of milk with it! 🙂
Any leftover cornbread can be refrigerated and then re-heat each slice in the microwave for 45 seconds before serving.

name: Thai Papaya Salad – Som Tum
summary: This Thai Papaya Salad – Som Tum is a refreshing and spicy salad made with crisp julienned green papaya, garlic, Thai chilies, palm sugar, lime juice, fish sauce, and tamarind for a punchy balance of sweet, sour, salty, and spicy. Tossed with cherry tomatoes, crushed peanuts, dried shrimp, and crunchy long beans, it's a bold and authentic dish typically made using a Thai mortar and pestle for optimal flavor blending. Serve it as a zesty appetizer or a flavorful side to grilled meats or sticky rice.
ingredients: 1/2 of a Green Papaya (equals 4 cups, julienned)
5 Chinese Long Beans (cut into 1 ½” pieces)
1 Tablespoon Dried Shrimp (soaked in hot water)
steps: Discard the seeds and use a knife to peel the skin of the green papaya.
Then use a papaya peeler to shred the papaya.
Immediately place the shredded papaya in a bowl of ice water to keep the papaya crunchy.
Pour the papaya into a colander to drain. Give it a couple of squeezes to remove excess water. Leave the shredded papaya in the colander and allow it to completely dry.
Soak the dried shrimp in a bowl of hot water for 10 minutes. Then drain and set aside.
In the meantime, mince the garlic and rough chop the Thai chilies.
Pound the minced garlic and Thai chilies until smashed in a large Thai som tum mortar. If you do not have a som tum mortar you can use a large mixing bowl instead.
Add the shaved palm sugar to the mortar and mash with the pestle.
Cut the long beans into 1 ½” inches and add them to the mortar. Pound them until they are slightly bruised .

In a separate small bowl crush the peanuts with the pestle until the peanuts are broken. Then divide the peanuts into 2 small dishes. Place 2 tablespoons of crushed peanuts into one of the dishes. These crushed peanuts will be added to the mortar. Place the remaining peanuts into the other dish which will be later used to garnish the salad.
Add the roasted peanuts and the rehydrated dried shrimp to the som tum mortar and pound until the shrimp is slightly bruised.
Add the fish sauce, tamarind concentrate, and squeeze in the lime juice. Stir everything together with a large spoon.
Cut the tomatoes in half and add to the mortar. Also add in the shredded papaya.
Give it a good mix with the spoon so that everything is coated with the sauce.
Then lightly pound with a pestle until the tomatoes are slightly bruised . Mix with a large spoon and pound at the same time.
Place in the refrigerator for about an hour before serving to allow all the flavors to marry.
Then plate and garnish with more crushed peanuts. (Optional).
The Papaya salad will keep in the fridge for 2-3 days.

name: Thai Tom Yum Hot Pot
summary: Thai Tom Yum Hot Pot is a vibrant, aromatic dish built around a rich, tangy broth infused with galangal, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and Tom Yum paste. The broth is simmered with tomatoes, pineapple, and Thai chilis for a spicy-sour depth. It's served bubbling hot with a variety of add-ins like napa cabbage, tofu, mushrooms, seafood (shrimp, mussels, squid), imitation crab, and fish balls. Accompanied by vermicelli noodles and a simple lemon-pepper dipping sauce, this hot pot is perfect for sharing and creates an interactive and comforting dining experience.
ingredients: 2 Lemongrass Stalks (smashed and cut into 2-inch sections)
1 Can Pineapple Chunks in Natural Juices (20 oz, drained – reserve the juice to drink)
3 Cartons Organic Chicken Broth (1 quart each)
3 Thai Chilis (sliced – adjust to taste or omit)
1 Tablespoon Fresh Squeezed Lime Juice (from half a lime)
To add to the hot pot:
1 Can Whole Peeled Straw Mushrooms (15 oz)
1 Package Frozen Curled Squid Chunks (14 oz)
1 Package Frozen Mussels in the Half Shell (2 lbs – use half the box)
16 Shrimp With Head On and Shelled (trim whiskers and legs, deveined)
steps: Pound lemon grass and cut into 2 inch lengths.
Cut the Kaffir Lime Leaves in half lengthwise.
Drain the pineapples (reserve juice to drink).
Slice the Thai chilis at an angle.
Make The Broth: In a pan on Medium heat pour in 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil. Once the oil is hot toss in the minced garlic and chopped shallots. Saute for about 1 minute.
Then toss in the lemon grass, galangal and lime leaves. Saute for about 2-3 minutes or until the lemon grass is is slightly softened.
Add in the tomatoes and pineapples. Saute for about 2-3 minutes or until the tomatoes are slightly cooked.
Add the Tom Yum paste and stir the broth.
Then add in the Fish Sauce.
Also add in the Totole Chicken Seasoning. Stir the broth.
Add the sliced Thai chilis and turn the heat to 'High'.
Just before the broth comes to a boil turn off the heat. Then pour in the lime juice and stir.

Let the broth cool a bit before transferring it to a hot pot . Only fill the hot pot half way with the broth. Keep in mind that the broth will rise as you add in your seafood and vegetables. Also as you continue to add in all the other ingredients, the broth will become diluted. You will need to replenish the hot pot with the reserved broth to keep it flavorful.

Once the broth has been transferred to the hotpot add in a handful or two of chopped Thai Basils. Place the hotpot in the center of your table and let it sit while you prepare the rest of the ingredients.

Prepare The Rest Of The Ingredients For The Hot Pot: Boil the noodles according to the directions on the package or instructions are also available on my website at www.EatWithEmily.com . Look under the tab 'Vietnamese Recipes' for 'How to cook Rice Stick Noodles'.
Wash the napa cabbage and cut into 1 1/2'' inches. Wash the button mushrooms and slice in half.
Wash the bok choy and cut into 1 1/2'' inches .
Drain the straw mushrooms and rinse.
Drain the corn and cut into thirds.
Drain the tofu, rinse and cut into bite size pieces.
Slice the imitation crab meat sticks at an angle or just cut into 3 sections.
Wash the mussels under cold water with 1 tablespoon of salt. Rinse off the salt, drain and set aside.
Wash the shrimp under cold water with 1 tablespoon of salt. Devein the shrimp. Trim the whiskers and legs. Leave the shell on the shrimp. Do not remove the shell.
Place the fish balls in a bowl.
Make The Dip: Cut a lemon into quarters.

Squeeze a lemon wedge into a dipping dish. Add a pinch of salt (optional). And also add a pinch of black pepper. Do this for each guest. This lemon juice dip is for the seafoods such as the mussels, shrimp and squid.
Instructions For Cooking The Hot Pot: Place all the ingredients next to the hot pot.
Bring the broth to a boil. First add in the items that will take the longest to cook like the corn, squid, fish balls and mushrooms.
Let the broth come back to a boil then add in the rest of the ingredients. Right before serving squeeze in a wedge or two of lime juice. Taste and adjust the soup.
Then serve the broth over a bowl of Vermicelli Noodles.
